1.2.38-002.info: A blue flashing light orders the following: "All other motorists must clear the way immediately". Therefore, it is necessary to ask oneself where the vehicle is coming from and whether continuing your journey might obstruct the vehicle.
1.2.38-002.text: You hear a siren. Which questions must you ask yourself?

1.2.38-003.asw_1: For dangers at roadworks or the scene of an accident
1.2.38-003.asw_3: For a large transport proceeding at low speed
1.2.38-003.info: A yellow flashing light warns of possible dangers. It can warn of vehicles with unusual widths and slow-moving large-capacity transports. The same applies to hazards at work and accident sites.
1.2.38-003.text: What can a flashing amber light on a vehicle be a warning for?

1.2.38-101.asw_1: Warning of an accident or other dangers
1.2.38-101.asw_3: A breakdown vehicle is on duty and on its way to its destination
1.2.38-101.info: Blue flashing lights alone may only be used by vehicles equipped with them and only for warning in the case of an accident or other conditions, during emergency drives or when accompanying vehicles or closed convoys.
1.2.38-101.text: What does it mean when the flashing blue light of a vehicle is switched on but not the siren?

1.2.38-102.asw_1: The vehicle is on duty. You should give way
1.2.38-102.asw_2: Advance warning of a closed convoy
1.2.38-102.asw_3: Without a siren, a flashing blue light does not mean anything
1.2.38-102.info: Blue flashing lights alone may only be used by vehicles equipped with them and only for warning in the case of an accident or other conditions, during emergency drives or when accompanying vehicles or closed convoys.
1.2.38-102.text: What can a flashing blue light (without siren) mean?

1.3.01-001.asw_3: At the end of a traffic calmed area
1.3.01-001.info: At crossroads and junctions, priority is given to those coming from the right. This does not apply if traffic signs specially regulate the right of way.
1.3.01-001.text: At which places where there are no traffic signs regulating priority does the rule "right before left" apply?

1.3.01-002.asw_3: At junctions of farm tracks or forest tracks with other roads
1.3.01-002.info: At crossroads and junctions, priority is given to those coming from the right. This does not apply if the right of way is specially regulated by traffic signs or for vehicles coming from a dirt road or forest road to another road. Anyone who wants to drive over a lowered kerbstone onto the road or from the edge of the road must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists.
1.3.01-002.text: At which places where there are no traffic signs regulating priority does the rule "right before left" apply?

1.3.01-003.asw_1: Wait, observe and come to an agreement with others, if necessary
1.3.01-003.asw_2: Proceed according to the rule "right before left"
1.3.01-003.asw_3: Always proceed when driving straight ahead
1.3.01-003.info: If the right-of-way situation is not immediately apparent, it is necessary to wait in order to first grasp the situation and, if necessary, to communicate the situation to other motorists.
1.3.01-003.text: You are approaching a crossroads where the priority situation is not clear to you straightaway. What do you do?

1.3.01-016-M.asw_1: I have to allow the blue truck to pass through
1.3.01-016-M.asw_2: I have to allow the tractor to turn
1.3.01-016-M.asw_3: The blue truck has to allow me to pass through
1.3.01-016-M.info: At this intersection, the right of way is regulated by the traffic sign, which indicates that motorists must "grant the right of way". The other two vehicles must thus be given priority.
1.3.01-016-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-017-M.asw_1: I have to allow the motorcycle to pass through
1.3.01-017-M.asw_2: I take priority before the bus
1.3.01-017-M.asw_3: I have to allow the bus to pass through
1.3.01-017-M.info: The traffic sign grants the right of way. This means you can drive in front of the bus. However, as a motorist about to make a left turn, it is necessary to let the oncoming traffic – and thus the motorcycle – pass first.
1.3.01-017-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-018-M.asw_1: I have to allow the motorcycle to pass through
1.3.01-018-M.asw_2: I take priority before the bus
1.3.01-018-M.asw_3: I have to allow the bus to pass through
1.3.01-018-M.info: The traffic sign "Give way" gives priority to the motorcyclist. The bus is turning left and has to let the oncoming traffic pass first.
1.3.01-018-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-021-M.asw_3: - be the first to make my turn
1.3.01-021-M.info: Wanting to turn left, priority must be given to oncoming motorists. Therefore, you may only turn after the motorcycle has passed. However, the yellow car has to wait because the car is turning off the main road.
1.3.01-021-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-035-M.asw_1: I give way to the green car
1.3.01-035-M.asw_2: I turn left before the green car
1.3.01-035-M.asw_3: I have to allow the red car to pass
1.3.01-035-M.info: Since no traffic signs regulate the right of way, whoever comes from the right has the right of way. The green car must thus be given priority.
1.3.01-035-M.text: What is the right thing to do?

1.3.01-038-M.asw_1: I have to give way to the motorcycle
1.3.01-038-M.asw_2: I have to give way to the blue car
1.3.01-038-M.asw_3: I may drive out before the blue car
1.3.01-038-M.info: The motorcyclist coming from the left is following the main road and has priority. The motorcyclist’s lane and the lane of the car coming from the right are of equal rank. So whoever comes from the right has the right of way. The blue car is thus allowed to proceed first.
1.3.01-038-M.text: What is the right thing to do?

1.3.01-042-M.asw_1: I have to allow the tram to pass through
1.3.01-042-M.asw_2: I have to allow the motorcycle to pass through
1.3.01-042-M.asw_3: The tram must allow me to make the turn first
1.3.01-042-M.info: The sign "grant right of way" gives priority to the tram. If you turn left, you have to let the oncoming traffic go first, which is why the motorcycle has priority.
1.3.01-042-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-046-M.asw_2: I have to allow the blue car to pass through
1.3.01-046-M.info: Your vehicle is following the main road, so the car coming from the right has to wait.
1.3.01-046-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-048-M.asw_1: I allow the blue car to turn
1.3.01-048-M.asw_2: I am the first to proceed
1.3.01-048-M.asw_3: I allow the motorcycle to turn before me
1.3.01-048-M.info: At this junction, priority is given to those coming from the right. This allows the blue car to turn first. The motorcyclist, on the other hand, is about to make a left turn and must give priority to oncoming traffic.
1.3.01-048-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-049-M.asw_1: I may be the first to proceed
1.3.01-049-M.asw_2: I have to give way to the red car
1.3.01-049-M.asw_3: I have to give way to the tram
1.3.01-049-M.info: Due to the priority road, you must pass the crossroads first. The tram and the red car must wait.
1.3.01-049-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-050-M.asw_2: I have to allow right of way to the blue car
1.3.01-050-M.asw_3: I have to allow right of way to the green car
1.3.01-050-M.info: You are following a priority road. Therefore, the blue car must wait. The green car is located on the priority road, but as it is about to make a left turn, it also must wait.
1.3.01-050-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.4.40-001.asw_3: Observe the traffic coming from the right only
1.4.40-001.info: The traffic sign indicates an intersection or junction with right of way priority.
1.4.40-001.text: What do you do when you see this traffic sign?

1.4.40-004.asw_2: When there are two lanes in one direction, employ the zipper feed-in method
1.4.40-004.asw_3: Where there are two lanes in one direction and you are driving on the left lane, you take absolute precedence
1.4.40-004.info: The traffic sign indicates a one-sided narrowed roadway. The bottleneck is on your side, so that oncoming traffic has priority on a street with one lane. On a carriageway with two lanes in one direction, the zipper feed-in method shall be used.
1.4.40-004.text: What do you do when you see this traffic sign?

1.4.40-005.asw_2: Dazzle from oncoming traffic at night
1.4.40-005.info: The traffic sign indicates oncoming traffic, e.g., at the end of a one-way street. Dazzle from oncoming traffic is possible at night.
1.4.40-005.text: You see this traffic sign. What must you reckon with?

1.4.40-006.info: The traffic sign indicates children may enter the road. It is mainly found near kindergartens and schools. In view of this danger, the driver is required to pay the utmost attention. The speed of the vehicle should be reduced. The driver must also be ready to brake.
1.4.40-006.text: What does this traffic sign require of you?

1.4.40-101.info: Outside of built-up areas, the traffic sign is generally 150 to 250 m in front of the potential danger. If the distance is considerably shorter, it may be indicated with an additional symbol.
1.4.40-101.text: You pass this traffic sign while driving outside a built-up area. How far off is the hazard to be expected?

1.4.40-103.asw_1: - this road may be used for winter sports
1.4.40-103.asw_2: - there is packed snow or black ice on the roadway
1.4.40-103.asw_3: - only the pavements are used for winter sports
1.4.40-103.info: The traffic sign warns of a potential danger The additional sign "Winter Sports" indicates the actual danger, namely that winter sports are practised on the roadway. Due to winter weather and road conditions, the road may be snowy or icy.
1.4.40-103.text: What must you be prepared for when you pass these traffic signs?

1.4.40-105.asw_2: Drive as far as possible over on the right-hand side
1.4.40-105.asw_3: Accelerate strongly immediately after the right bend
1.4.40-105.info: The traffic sign indicates a double curve. In view of the centrifugal forces that can act in such a curve, it is important to reduce your speed in a timely manner. Oncoming traffic could intersect at the bend, which is why it is important to drive to the extreme right.
1.4.40-105.text: What do you do when you see this traffic sign?

1.4.40-106.asw_1: A downhill slope 800 m in length
1.4.40-106.asw_2: An uphill slope 800 m in length
1.4.40-106.asw_3: The beginning of a downhill slope 800 m ahead
1.4.40-106.info: The combination of danger sign and additional sign warns of a gradient of 800 m in length.
1.4.40-106.text: What do you have to expect after these traffic signs?

1.4.40-108.asw_3: Avoid the uneven patches by making sudden steering wheel movements
1.4.40-108.info: The traffic sign indicates unevenness in the road surface. If the speed is too high, there is a risk of skidding or damage to the vehicle. It is thus necessary to reduce your speed.
1.4.40-108.text: What should you do when you approach this traffic sign?

1.4.40-109.asw_1: The vehicle could go into a skid and endanger oncoming traffic
1.4.40-109.asw_2: The vehicle could suffer a broken axle or spring fracture
1.4.40-109.info: There is a warning of unevenness and damage to the road surface. The vehicle skidding is thus possible. Additionally, an axle break could cause unsafe driving. In addition, damage to the cargo cannot be ruled out.

1.4.40-112.asw_1: Danger of skidding when the roadway is dirty
1.4.40-112.asw_2: Danger of skidding when the roadway is wet
1.4.40-112.asw_3: Drivers under the influence of alcohol
1.4.40-112.info: The traffic sign warns of the danger of skidding or slipping when the road is wet or dirty.
1.4.40-112.text: What does this traffic sign warn you of?

1.4.40-114.asw_3: Always stop before the road narrows
1.4.40-114.info: The traffic sign warns of a narrowing roadway on both sides. The speed should be reduced. Overtaking is no longer possible.
1.4.40-114.text: What do you do when you see this traffic sign?

1.4.40-115.asw_1: The roadway narrowing approximately 50 m ahead
1.4.40-115.info: The traffic sign warns of a roadway narrowed on both sides and located 50 m away.

1.4.40-116.asw_2: Men at work on the roadway
1.4.40-116.info: The traffic sign warns of a construction site. This is accompanied by the risk of workers moving on the road. There may also be building materials on the road. Traffic from construction site vehicles is to be expected.

1.4.40-118.asw_2: The vehicles driving in front may suddenly brake
1.4.40-118.asw_3: The roadway widens into three lanes
1.4.40-118.info: The traffic sign warns of a place where there is a risk of traffic jams. Sudden braking of the preceding driver is to be expected. An end to the traffic jam must be expected.

1.4.40-121.asw_3: A level crossing with flashing red light
1.4.40-121.info: The traffic sign indicates a traffic light system that is difficult to recognize.

1.4.40-127.asw_1: A level crossing on the road turning right
1.4.40-127.asw_2: The direction from which a train could come
1.4.40-127.asw_3: A diversion avoiding the level crossing

1.4.40-130.asw_1: A level crossing approximately 160 m ahead
1.4.40-130.asw_2: A level crossing approximately 80 m ahead

1.4.40-131.asw_1: A level crossing approximately 80 m ahead
1.4.40-131.asw_2: A level crossing approximately 160 m ahead
1.4.40-131.asw_3: A level crossing approximately 240 m ahead
1.4.40-131.info: The single-stripe beacon indicates that there is a level crossing approx. 80 m away.
1.4.40-131.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

1.4.41-001.asw_2: When the level crossing cannot be crossed without having to stop on it
1.4.41-001.asw_3: When a rail vehicle is approaching
1.4.41-001.info: Vehicles in front of the level crossing have to wait at a safe distance in front of the level crossing for pedestrians when a rail vehicle approaches or when a railway employee orders a stop. You should also wait at the level crossing if it is not possible to cross without stopping in the level crossing in the meantime.

1.4.41-004.asw_2: You may only proceed to the right

1.4.41-005.asw_3: You may not proceed to the left
1.4.41-005.info: Anyone driving a vehicle must follow the prescribed direction of travel. If you want to turn, you must signal this clearly and in a timely manner by using the direction indicators.

1.4.41-006.info: Only drive straight ahead or to the right. If you want to turn right, you must indicate this clearly and in a timely manner by using the direction indicators.

1.4.41-007.asw_2: You are obliged to turn right

1.4.41-008.asw_3: Speed must not be reduced when a bus stops at a stopping bay

1.4.41-010.asw_2: You may drive a motor vehicle at walking speed in this pedestrian precinct
1.4.41-010.asw_3: Residents may drive motor vehicles in this pedestrian precinct

1.4.41-013.asw_2: You may not enter this road

1.4.41-015.asw_1: Stopping for loading or unloading, for alighting or boarding vehicles
1.4.41-015.asw_3: Parking, provided a parking disc is used
1.4.41-015.info: The sign indicates the following mandatory rule: "limited stopping restriction". Any person driving a vehicle may not stop on the road for more than three minutes, except for boarding, disembarking, loading or unloading.

1.4.41-016.asw_3: With a parking ticket from a parking-ticket machine (Parkscheinautomat), anyone is allowed to park here for an unlimited period
1.4.41-016.info: The sign indicates the following mandatory direction: "limited stopping restriction". A person driving a vehicle may not stop on the road for more than three minutes, except when getting into or out of the vehicle or when loading or unloading. The additional sign excludes severely handicapped people with extraordinary walking disabilities, bilateral amelia or phokomelia (birth defects) or with comparable function restrictions as well as blind people. In each case, the handicapped person must be in possession of a special parking permit releasing him or her from the stop prohibition. The exemption only applies if the parking card is clearly legible.

1.4.41-102.asw_2: You are not allowed to turn

1.4.41-109.asw_1: Yes, because children frequently run across the road to catch the bus

1.4.41-130.asw_3: Roadway with two lanes in one direction for 3 km

1.4.41-131.asw_3: End of a no-overtaking area 200 m ahead
