1.1.06-114.info:
Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the subsequent traffic.

When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists. If you overtake, you have to get back into the right lane as soon as possible. Those who overtake must not hinder those who are being overtaken.

Because the blue car is leaving the parking space, the cyclist will probably have to make a detour to the left. The process of overtaking must thus be stopped.

1.1.07-146.asw_2: - will come to a sudden stop
1.1.07-146.asw_3: - will remain stationary in the right-hand lane
1.1.07-146.asw_pretext: That the truck in front of me
1.1.07-146.info: The truck could swing out even further in order to get around the bend with the trailer. The truck has to wait opposite the pedestrian, which is why it may stop.

1.2.37-011-M.asw_2: At the point where you can see along the intersecting road (sight line)
1.2.37-011-M.info: The traffic light takes precedence over other traffic signs that regulate priority. If - as in this case - a stop line exists, your vehicle must stop at this line.

1.3.01-053.asw_1: Vehicles coming from the left and from the right
1.3.01-053.asw_2: For cyclists and pedestrians alongside you to the right or behind you
1.3.01-053.asw_3: Only for vehicles coming from the left
1.3.01-053.info: If you want to turn, you have to yield to oncoming vehicles, rail vehicles, electric bicycles and cyclists even if they are driving on or beside the road in the same direction. Vehicles from the left and from the right must be watched because they are driving on the priority road.
1.3.01-053.text: You want to turn right into a priority road. What must you look out for?

2.1.11-125.asw_3: The state of the road surface
2.1.11-125.info: Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that no obstruction of oncoming traffic will take place during the entire overtaking process. Overtaking is not permitted if the traffic situation is unclear. In this case, there is regular oncoming traffic. In addition, the traffic situation is unclear because the view of the roadway is severely restricted by trees.
2.1.11-125.text: You want to overtake. Why should you not do so?

2.2.15-112.asw_1: - the hazard lights must be switched on on both vehicles
2.2.15-112.asw_2: - the towing cable should be kept as taut as possible
2.2.15-112.asw_3: - the motorway may only be used to shorten the journey to the next car garage
2.2.15-112.info: While being towed, both vehicles must have their hazard warning lights switched on. The towing cable should be kept as taut as possible to prevent damage (e.g., due to a strong jolt or grinding on the road surface).
2.2.15-112.text: You car has a fault and can no longer be driven. What must you be aware of during towing?

2.6.02-030.asw_2: An entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.6.02-030.asw_3: The loss of my insurance cover
2.6.02-030.info: Participation in public road traffic with a vehicle whose operating license has expired can be punished with a fine. In addition, there is a threat of entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders. In addition, a loss of insurance coverage is to be expected.
2.6.02-030.text: A technical modification to your vehicle means that the operating licence is extinguished. What consequences should you anticipate if you nevertheless use the vehicle on public roads?

2.8.01-009.asw_1: An order to attend an advanced seminar for new drivers
2.8.01-009.asw_2: Entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.8.01-009.asw_3: An order to resit a theoretical driving licence test
2.8.01-009.info: Failure to observe the traffic sign constitutes a serious infringement during the probationary period. There is the threat of an order to participate in an advanced seminar for new drivers and an entry in the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders.
2.8.01-009.text: You are currently in the probationary period and to date have not come to the attention of the authorities. What consequences may result if you fail to observe the traffic sign "Stop. Give way." and thereby endanger other road users?

2.8.01-010.asw_1: A more considerate and risk-conscious attitude to driving on public roads
2.8.01-010.asw_3: Reducing the number of points in the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.8.01-010.info: The focus of an advanced seminar is the attitude towards road traffic. Participants should be sensitised to behave more considerately in traffic later on. In addition, the detection of traffic hazards is to be improved.
2.8.01-010.text: What should be achieved by attending an advanced seminar during the probationary period?

1.1.05-105.asw_1: I look out for people who could walk onto the road
1.1.05-105.asw_2: I may only pass the bus at walking speed
1.1.05-105.asw_3: I may not drive past the bus
1.1.05-105.info:
Passengers may enter the road, so increased caution is advisable.

Scheduled buses and marked school buses stopped at bus stops with hazard warning lights turned on may only be overtaken at walking speed and at such a distance that passengers are not endangered.

Walking speed also applies to oncoming traffic on the same road. Bus passengers must not be obstructed. If necessary, anyone driving a vehicle must wait.
1.1.05-105.text: What do you have to be aware of in this situation?

1.1.07-014-M.asw_2: A vehicle driving past the bus
1.1.07-014-M.asw_3: That I will have to stop at the junction
1.1.07-014-M.info: Due to the limited view of the bus, other vehicles may not be seen until later. People who want to get on or off the bus could cross the road. A vehicle could overtake the bus and appear at any time. Due to these dangers, it may be necessary to stop at the intersection.

1.1.07-147.asw_1: For the vehicle on the road ahead
1.1.07-147.info: The car in front could stop because of the pedestrian. A cyclist was seen in the mirror, and the cyclist has now entered the blind spot. This must also be observed.
1.1.07-147.text: What must you watch out for now?

1.2.02-107.asw_1: - into the gap to allow the oncoming vehicle to drive past
1.2.02-107.asw_2: - onwards, because the oncoming vehicle has to reverse
1.2.02-107.asw_3: - backwards, because the oncoming vehicle has right of way
1.2.02-107.info: Participation in road traffic requires constant caution and mutual respect. Using the gap is a simple and safe way to let the other vehicle pass.
1.2.02-107.text: What should you do in this situation?

1.2.09-112-M.info: You must indicate a turn to the left vehicle is entering another road. The same goes for the blue truck. It follows the main road, but because it is also turning off the road, signalling is necessary.

1.2.11-103-M.asw_1: I remain waiting in my lane
1.2.11-103-M.asw_2: I move to the right if there is sufficient space in the traffic
1.2.11-103-M.asw_3: I overtake the vehicle alongside me and switch lanes
1.2.11-103-M.info: There is no sufficient space in the traffic on the right, so it is important to stay in lane for the time being. If a sufficient space in the traffic is maintained on the right, the lane may be changed.
1.2.11-103-M.text: You want to continue driving straight ahead. What is the right course of action?

1.2.26-119-M.asw_1: I wait, because the two pedestrians have priority
1.2.26-119-M.asw_2: I continue driving, because the two pedestrians have to wait
1.2.26-119-M.asw_3: I take the turn before the oncoming pedestrian, because only this one is required to wait
1.2.26-119-M.info: Your vehicle is about to turn onto a street that may also be crossed by two pedestrians at the same time. Both pedestrians have priority, so you have to wait.
1.2.26-119-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-055-M.info: At this intersection, priority is given to those coming from the right. This means that you have to drive behind the yellow car. Because you have to turn left, oncoming traffic – in this case the blue truck – has priority.
1.3.01-055-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-056-M.info: The traffic sign grants right of way, meaning the other two cars must wait.
1.3.01-056-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.4.42-139.asw_1: That the flowing traffic will come to a stop
1.4.42-139.asw_2: That children will cross the road more frequently than usual
1.4.42-139.asw_3: That children will be playing on the road under supervision
1.4.42-139.info: The traffic sign indicates possible traffic assistants (lollipop men). It can be assumed that more children than usual cross the road at certain times. It is to be expected that the flowing traffic will be interrupted by stops.
1.4.42-139.text: What must you be prepared for here?

2.1.03-115.asw_3: I switch to the left lane now
2.1.03-115.info: The visibility conditions are not good; the road surface could be slippery and the lane could be affected by heavy snowdrifts. It is not possible to merge to the left because another vehicle is overtaking. Therefore, it is necessary to slow down and wait at the obstacle.
2.1.03-115.text: What is the right course of action?

2.1.03-116-M.asw_3: - drive to the left past the damaged road surface
2.1.03-116-M.info: Due to the path of the road and the vegetation, visibility is severely restricted and the road surface is poor. There may be an obstacle on the road, which is why it is necessary to reduce your speed. It is necessary to stay in your lane. Merging into another lane would hardly improve visibility, whilst increasing the risk of collision with oncoming traffic.

1.1.07-022.asw_2: I drive carefully past to the right of the truck
1.1.07-022.asw_3: I move into the middle lane now
1.1.07-022.info: The situation is confusing: The truck driver probably wants to drive backwards into the construction site. Due to the proximity of the truck and a car in the blind spot, there is no safe way out. It is necessary to stop and let the truck complete its manoeuvre.

1.2.02-108.asw_2: - drive as far to the right as possible
1.2.02-108.info: Participation in road traffic requires constant caution and mutual respect. To prevent the horses from being startled or unsettled, it is advisable to avoid noise and drive as far to the right as possible.
1.2.02-108.text: A horse-drawn carriage is coming towards you. What should you do?

1.2.05-119.info: Horse-drawn carriages must signal the changing of the direction of travel. This can be done using indicators. If the carriage has no indicators, the driver of the coach has the option of either displaying a traffic paddle or stretching out his or her arm.
1.2.05-119.text: How can you tell if a horse-drawn carriage wants to change direction?

1.2.05-120.asw_2: - the most space to the side as possible
1.2.05-120.info: Horses can be startled by noise. In order to prevent hazards in road traffic, unnecessary noise must thus be avoided. Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists.
1.2.05-120.text: You want to overtake a horse-drawn carriage on a rural road. What should you do?

1.2.09-125.info: There is a tram coming towards you. If you want to turn, you have to yield to oncoming vehicles, rail vehicles, electric bicycles and cyclists even if they are driving on or beside the road in the same direction.
1.2.09-125.text: Why are you required to stop now?

1.2.09-126.asw_1: - not overtake the moped before the rail crossing
1.2.09-126.asw_2: - overtake the moped, while allowing sufficient space to the side
1.2.09-126.asw_3: - overtake the moped before the rail crossing once the cyclist is out of the way
1.2.09-126.info: Road traffic may approach level crossings only at a moderate speed. Anyone driving a vehicle may not overtake motor vehicles at level crossings from sign 151, 156 up to and including the rail crossing area between the tracks and the road.
1.2.09-126.text: What is the right course of action here?

1.2.19-114.asw_1: I wait in front of the level crossing
1.2.19-114.info: If the level crossing cannot be crossed quickly and without a stop due to road traffic, wait in front of the St. Andrew's Cross. (Note: The blue car is stopped directly behind the level crossing.)
1.2.19-114.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.2.26-007.asw_1: I stop because a man wants to cross the pedestrian crossing
1.2.26-007.asw_2: I continue driving slowly, because there is no indication that any pedestrian wants to cross the pedestrian crossing
1.2.26-007.asw_3: I stop because a child behind the van is going to walk onto the road
1.2.26-007.info: The jogger is approaching the zebra crossing purposefully. Since he has priority, we must stop.
1.2.26-007.text: What is the right course of action?

1.2.34-112.asw_3: - ground markings on the hard shoulder
1.2.34-112.info: Black arrows (directional triangles) on delineators indicate the shortest route to the nearest emergency telephone.
1.2.34-112.text: How can you tell the shortest way to the next emergency telephone on federal motorways?

1.3.01-057-M.asw_1: I have to allow the red car to pass through
1.3.01-057-M.asw_2: I may proceed before the blue truck
1.3.01-057-M.asw_3: I may only proceed after the blue truck
1.3.01-057-M.info: Oncoming traffic – and thus the red car – has priority. The priority road that bends off is to be exited. Nevertheless, the right of way still exists, meaning the blue truck has to wait.
1.3.01-057-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.4.40-009.asw_1: Danger in connection with horse and carriages
1.4.40-009.asw_2: That horse and carriages have priority over motor vehicles
1.4.40-009.asw_3: Horse and carriages are not allowed to pass through
1.4.40-009.info: The traffic sign warns of danger. The additional plate points out the actual danger, i.e., horse carriages.
1.4.40-009.text: What does this traffic sign combination indicate?

1.4.42-140.asw_1: I have to drive at walking speed
1.4.42-140.asw_3: I may only park on designated places
1.4.42-140.info: The traffic sign indicates the beginning of a traffic-calmed area. Anyone who drives a vehicle must drive at walking speed. Anyone driving a vehicle must not endanger or obstruct pedestrian traffic. If necessary, vehicles must wait. Anyone driving a vehicle may not park outside the designated areas, except for boarding, disembarking, loading or unloading.
1.4.42-140.text: What applies according to this traffic sign?

1.5.01-010.info: The professional disposal of waste oil, lubricants and vehicle batteries can be carried out via car workshops and recycling centres.
1.5.01-010.text: Where can used oil, lubricants and car batteries be taken to be disposed of properly?

1.5.01-014.info: Low-resistance tyres reduce rolling resistance and thus help to reduce fuel consumption. Low-viscosity oils reduce friction in the engine and thus also help to protect the environment.
1.5.01-014.text: What measures help protect the environment?

1.5.01-118.asw_1: - generate less friction in the engine
1.5.01-118.asw_3: - can be disposed of as household waste
1.5.01-118.info: Low-viscosity oils reduce friction in the engine. In this way, they contribute to lower fuel consumption.
1.5.01-118.text: Why is it beneficial to use low viscosity engine oil?

1.5.01-120.asw_1: - removing any non-essential roof boxes etc
1.5.01-120.asw_3: - driving with winter tyres the whole year round
1.5.01-120.info: Roof superstructures increase air resistance and thus increase fuel consumption. A proactive driving style contributes to low fuel consumption.

1.5.01-121.asw_1: I refrain as much as possible from rapid acceleration
1.5.01-121.asw_2: I regularly check the tyre inflation pressure
1.5.01-121.asw_3: I use winter tyres all year round
1.5.01-121.info: Avoiding strong acceleration contributes to a long service life of the tyres. In addition, the air pressure must be checked regularly to avoid driving with tyre pressure that is too low.
1.5.01-121.text: How can you minimise tyre wear?

1.5.01-122.asw_3: All motor vehicles belonging to the environmental zone inhabitants
1.5.01-122.info: Ambulances in use are exempted from the traffic ban in environmental zones, as are agricultural and forestry tractors.
1.5.01-122.text: What vehicles are generally exempt from the ban on road traffic in "environmental zones"?

2.1.02-003.asw_1: Because someone is walking onto the road
2.1.02-003.asw_2: Because passengers are exiting the tram
2.1.02-003.asw_3: Because the truck is switching into my lane
2.1.02-003.info: A person is running onto the road in front of the truck and could cross the lane. In order not to endanger this pedestrian, it is necessary to brake.
2.1.02-003.text: Why do you have to brake?

2.1.03-028.asw_2: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
2.1.03-028.asw_3: I remain in the centre of my lane
2.1.03-028.info: A pedestrian forces the oncoming truck to pull out. It cuts into the road, which is why you have to brake and drive as far to the right as possible.
2.1.03-028.text: What is the right course of action?

2.1.03-029.info: Due to the high snowfall at the edge of the road, both your own visibility and the visibility of the green car is impaired. It seems as if the green car will cross the road immediately. It is thus necessary to brake and defuse the dangerous situation.

2.1.03-030.info: The road is very narrow and there is a truck approaching. It may be necessary to stop first and find a safe solution in order to pass.
2.1.03-030.text: Why should you ready yourself to have to stop here?

2.1.06-011.info: The blue car is obviously driving too fast and is crossing the dividing line, threatening a collision.
2.1.06-011.text: Why should you brake hard now?

2.1.07-018.asw_2: I move into the left-hand lane
2.1.07-018.info: The cyclist leaves the cycle path and crosses the road. It is necessary to brake in order to keep sufficient distance. It is not possible to merge into the left-hand lane because a vehicle is already approaching there.
2.1.07-018.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.1.07-020.asw_1: I continue driving as far to the right as possible
2.1.07-020.asw_3: I move into the left-hand lane
2.1.07-020.info: There is a driver approaching in the wrong direction. Driving as far to the right as possible reduces the risk of a collision. In addition, you must brake in order to further reduce the risk.

2.1.08-016.asw_2: I switch on my hazard lights
2.1.08-016.asw_3: I continue driving in the clear lane
2.1.08-016.info: There is a traffic jam. It is necessary to slow down in order to approach the end of the congestion carefully. By switching on the hazard warning light, the following traffic will be warned of the danger.

2.1.08-017.asw_1: With an obstacle situated around the corner
2.1.08-017.asw_2: That the bend will become tighter as it progresses
2.1.08-017.asw_3: With oncoming traffic on my lane
2.1.08-017.info: The layout of the bend can only be guessed; it could still narrow. The bend is difficult to see because of the vegetation. An obstacle on the road cannot be ruled out.
2.1.08-017.text: What should you anticipate with this bend?

2.2.18-013.asw_1: - as far to the right as possible
2.2.18-013.asw_2: - as far to the left as possible
2.2.18-013.asw_pretext: I continue driving on my lane
2.2.18-013.info: On a three-lane motorway, the rescue lane is formed between the left and middle lanes. It is thus important to drive as far to the right as possible.

2.2.18-014.asw_2: I get in line on the hard shoulder
2.2.18-014.asw_3: I stop on my lane and wait for a gap
2.2.18-014.info: A traffic jam has formed on the exit lane that protrudes into the hard shoulder. Driving on the hard shoulder is not permitted, which is why it is necessary to continue driving in order to use the next exit, for example.

2.4.42-103.info: The "hydrogen filling station" symbol indicates a hydrogen filling station.
2.4.42-103.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-104.info: The "natural gas filling station" symbol indicates a natural gas filling station.
2.4.42-104.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-105.info: The "Autogastankstelle" (auto gas filling station) sign indicates an auto gas filling station.
2.4.42-105.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-106.asw_1: A charging station for electric vehicles
2.4.42-106.asw_2: A danger of explosion at a filling station through electric devices
2.4.42-106.asw_3: A facility for charging mobile telephones
2.4.42-106.info: The traffic sign indicates a charging station for electric vehicles.
2.4.42-106.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-107.asw_1: A carpark with connections to public transport ("Park + Ride")
2.4.42-107.asw_2: A filling station with carwash ("Care + Clean")
2.4.42-107.asw_3: A car hire centre with repair workshop ("Breakdown service + Repair")
2.4.42-107.info: This traffic sign indicates a car park that has access to public transport (parking and travel).
2.4.42-107.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.5.01-011.info: Winter tyres are designed for driving at low temperatures. Tyre wear increases at higher temperatures. At the same time, high rolling resistances occur, resulting in higher fuel consumption.
2.5.01-011.text: What is caused by driving with winter tyres during the summer months?

2.5.01-013.info: Waste water is treated at a carwash, which noticeably reduces the burden on the environment.
2.5.01-013.text: You want to wash your car. Where should you do this in the interests of environmental protection?

2.5.01-014.info: Electric consumption also increases fuel consumption because this subjects the alternator to greater demands. Accordingly, the activation of heated seating leads to higher fuel consumption. A switched on air conditioner has the same effect.
2.5.01-014.text: What increases the fuel consumption of your vehicle considerably?

2.6.03-001.asw_1: If the line-of-sight is broken to the person directing, the vehicle must be stopped
2.6.03-001.asw_2: A person directing is only required when driving into a priority road
2.6.03-001.asw_3: A person directing is not needed when on a factory premises
2.6.03-001.info: Anyone driving a vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists when turning into a property, when turning and when reversing. If necessary, they must let themselves be directed. If the line-of-sight of the person directing is hindered or broken, stop.
2.6.03-001.text: What is the correct response if, when reversing a combination vehicle the view to the rear is impeded?

2.7.02-030.asw_1: I go to a car workshop
2.7.02-030.asw_2: I do not need to fix the problem, as long as I can compensate by counter-steering
2.7.02-030.info: If the vehicle pulls to the side when braking, this indicates technical problems with the brake system. As this impairs safety, a specialist at a car workshop must be consulted.
2.7.02-030.text: When braking, you note that your vehicle pulls to the right. What should you do?

1.2.02-104-M.asw_1: I continue driving straight ahead or turn left
1.2.02-104-M.asw_2: I move carefully into the right-hand lane
1.2.02-104-M.asw_3: I drive straight ahead and turn right at the intersection
1.2.02-104-M.info: It is too late to change the lane; the line is undivided. Stay in the left lane and either drive straight ahead or turn.
1.2.02-104-M.text: You have manoeuvred into the left lane by mistake, but would like to take a right turn. What is the right course of action?

1.2.04-102.asw_2: I increase my distance to the vehicle in front moving into my lane
1.2.04-102.info: The car suddenly turning reduces the safety distance. You must brake to restore an appropriate safety distance.
1.2.04-102.text: What is the right course of action?

1.2.09-127.info: From the left, a motorcycle is approaching at high speed and turning off without yielding. Defensive driving behaviour is required, meaning braking is required to prevent a collision.
1.2.09-127.text: Why are you required to brake now?

1.3.01-103-M.asw_2: The motorbike is obliged to wait
1.3.01-103-M.info: At this intersection, priority is given to those coming from the right. The motorcyclist thus has priority.
1.3.01-103-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-121-M.asw_1: I have to allow the tram to pass through
1.3.01-121-M.asw_2: I have to allow the tractor to pass through
1.3.01-121-M.asw_3: I may not stop and wait on the rails
1.3.01-121-M.info: Although priority is given to the tractor, it is necessary for those turning left to give priority to the approaching tram.
1.3.01-121-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.4.41-155.asw_2: - stop only if there is a stop line
1.4.41-155.asw_3: - stop only if there is cross-wise moving traffic
1.4.41-155.info: The traffic sign "Stop! Give way!" (stop sign) orders to stop and give way.
1.4.41-155.text: What must you do upon seeing this traffic sign?

1.4.41-156.asw_1: - stop at the line of sight and give way
1.4.41-156.asw_2: - not stop, because there is no stop line
1.4.41-156.asw_3: - stop only if there is cross-wise moving traffic
1.4.41-156.info: Due to the traffic sign "Stop! Allow right of way", it is necessary to stop and allow right of way. There is no stop line, so you must stop at the line of sight.
1.4.41-156.text: What do you have to do in this traffic situation?

1.4.41-157.asw_1: - stop at the stop line and give way
1.4.41-157.asw_2: - stop only at the stop sign
1.4.41-157.asw_3: - stop only if there is cross-wise moving traffic
1.4.41-157.info: The traffic sign "Stop! Give way" orders you to stop at the stop line and give way.
1.4.41-157.text: What do you have to do in this traffic situation?

1.5.01-123.asw_1: During lengthy waits at rail crossings
1.5.01-123.asw_2: When loading and unloading the vehicle
1.5.01-123.asw_3: When stopping at intersections with a stop sign
1.5.01-123.info: Loading and unloading vehicles usually takes longer and does not require the engine to run. Therefore, the engine must be switched off. The same applies to waiting at level crossings.
1.5.01-123.text: When is it sensible to switch off a combustion engine?

2.5.01-207.asw_1: - combining several destinations into one single trip
2.5.01-207.asw_2: - forming car pools with other vehicle users
2.5.01-207.asw_3: - planning to use public transport instead of my own vehicle
2.5.01-207.info: By combining several destinations, longer single trips can be avoided. Carpooling also reduces negative environmental impacts. The same applies to the use of public transport.
2.5.01-207.text: When planning your journeys, how can you make them environmentally-friendlier?

2.5.01-208.asw_1: - select a gear in which I am not required to brake a great deal
2.5.01-208.asw_pretext: I take my foot off the accelerator completely and
2.5.01-208.info: On slopes, it is possible to use the braking effect of the engine by driving in a correspondingly low gear.
2.5.01-208.text: How do you drive down a descending gradient safely?

2.5.01-209.asw_1: All two and three-wheeled motor vehicles
2.5.01-209.asw_3: All motor vehicles with a catalytic converter

1.4.41-163.info: The traffic sign indicates a taxi stand. Consequently, taxis are expected to arrive and depart here.

1.4.41-164.asw_2: - may not be used by traffic in winter

1.4.41-164.info: The sign warning of a "Danger point" is supplemented by the additional sign that indicates "Winter sports permitted". This means that winter sports enthusiasts can also use the road, which is something that other motorists have to adjust to.

1.4.42-143.info: The traffic sign indicates a customs office.

2.1.11-130.info: The driver's attention should always be focused on the driving activity in order to have the vehicle under the best possible control and to be able to follow the traffic situation without restriction.
2.1.11-130.text: Your passenger wants to discuss something with you during the journey. What should you do?

2.1.11-131.asw_1: I take the passenger’s comments seriously
2.1.11-131.info: As a rule, the distance to a vehicle in front must be such that it can be held even if the driver of the vehicle in front of you brakes suddenly. Any information the passenger provides that contributes to safety must be taken seriously.
2.1.11-131.text: During the journey your passenger informs you that you are repeatedly tailgating. What should you do?

2.2.05-103-M.info: The red car is overtaking in a bend that cannot be seen. Due to the hilltop, visibility is restricted. Therefore, oncoming traffic is only visible at a late stage.

2.2.07-007.asw_1: I stay in the middle lane and slow down
2.2.07-007.asw_2: I move to the right-hand lane and slow down
2.2.07-007.asw_3: I move into the left-hand lane and overtake the red car in front of me
2.2.07-007.info: You continue in the middle lane and wait because the yellow car will merge.

2.2.07-008.asw_2: I continue driving without changing speed
2.2.07-008.asw_3: I move into the right-hand lane
2.2.07-008.info: The blue car in the left lane is slower. To avoid overtaking from the right, reduce your own speed.

2.2.07-009.info: The grey car has accelerated on the merging lane, overtaken the truck and is expected to switch from the left to the middle lane.

2.2.07-010.asw_1: I reduce my speed and stay in the middle lane
2.2.07-010.asw_2: I maintain my speed and stay in the middle lane
2.2.07-010.asw_3: I maintain my speed and move into the right-hand lane
2.2.07-010.info: The blue car on the left lane is slower. To avoid overtaking from the right, reduce your own speed.

2.2.09-003-M.asw_1: - once the red vehicle has overtaken me
2.2.09-003-M.asw_2: - now in order to make the carriageway clear
2.2.09-003-M.asw_3: - now so that following vehicles will not be confused by my slowing down

2.2.17-114.info: At dusk, in the dark or when visibility otherwise requires, the prescribed lighting equipment must be used. This also pertains to driving through a tunnel.

2.2.18-103.asw_1: I continue driving and leave the motorway at one of the next exits
2.2.18-103.asw_2: I reverse back on the hard shoulder, because the exit is less than 100 m behind me
2.2.18-103.asw_3: I stop on the hard shoulder to plan my subsequent route
2.2.18-103.info: If you missed a motorway exit, take the next one. Turning or similar manoeuvres are not permitted here.

2.2.22-122.asw_3: - may have individual bars projecting out to the side
2.2.22-122.info: The load must always be adequately secured. The vehicle must not make any noise that can be avoided.
