2.2.23-117.asw_1: - remove ice and snow from the windows
2.2.23-117.asw_2: - remove ice and snow from the mirrors
2.2.23-117.asw_3: - remove ice and snow from the roof of the vehicle
2.2.23-117.info: Snow and ice must be completely removed from the windows to ensure the best possible visibility. Additionally, snow and ice must be removed from the mirrors. Snow and ice must also be removed from the roof so that components do not come loose during the journey and endanger other motorists.
2.2.23-117.text: Your vehicle is snowed under. What do you have to do before you drive off?

2.2.23-118.asw_1: - remove ice and snow from the windows and mirrors
2.2.23-118.asw_2: - remove ice and snow from the lighting systems including during daytime
2.2.23-118.asw_3: - allow the engine to warm up
2.2.23-118.info: Snow and ice must be completely removed from the windows and mirrors to ensure the best possible visibility. Additionally, snow and ice must be removed from the lighting systems.
2.2.23-118.text: Your vehicle is snowed under. What do you have to do before you drive off?

2.6.03-111.asw_1: If it is not possible to observe all relevant road traffic situations without additional rear-view mirrors
2.6.03-111.asw_2: If the load platform of the trailer exceeds a width of 1.5 m and a height of 1 m
2.6.03-111.asw_3: If you are pulling a caravan or a trailer used in agriculture and forestry
2.6.03-111.info: It is not the dimensions of the trailer but the actual visibility conditions that determine whether additional rear-view mirrors should be fitted to the vehicle. As soon as not all essential traffic processes can be observed, additional mirrors are necessary.
2.6.03-111.text: You want to pull a trailer. When do additional rear-view mirrors have be to attached to your motor vehicle?

2.6.06-213.asw_1: - including the load actually has a maximum width of 2 m
2.6.06-213.asw_2: - is 2 m wide according to the registration certificate part I (Motor Vehicle Registration)
2.6.06-213.info: The traffic sign indicates the maximum width of the vehicle (including load and mirrors) that is permitted for the use of the left lane.
2.6.06-213.text: When are you allowed to remain on the left-hand lane in this situation?

2.7.01-130.asw_1: The steering capability is retained for longer
2.7.01-130.asw_2: The vehicle will always remain stable
2.7.01-130.asw_3: It is not possible for the vehicle to skid out of the bend
2.7.01-130.info: Vehicles without ABS are difficult to control when braking and tend to break out early. With ABS, steering ability is maintained for longer.
2.7.01-130.text: You suddenly have to brake when cornering on a wet carriageway. What special aspects exist with a vehicle equipped with an anti-lock braking system (ABS)?

1.1.03-005.asw_2: I avoid heavy braking and abrupt steering movements
1.1.03-005.asw_3: I swerve onto the left-hand side of the road
1.1.03-005.info:
Oil on the road surface can significantly impair road grip and thus cause the vehicle to swerve.

Therefore, strong braking and jerky steering should be avoided. The fire brigade must be informed so that they can remove the trace of oil.
1.1.03-005.text: There is oil on the road. What should you do now?

1.1.03-119-M.asw_1: Because spray water could otherwise impede visibility
1.1.03-119-M.asw_2: Because the braking distance is longer than on a dry road
1.1.03-119-M.asw_3: Because uneven areas of the road will otherwise be detected later
1.1.03-119-M.info:
The vehicle in front splashes water, which can impair visibility. Pavements with cobblestones can have larger unevenness, the depth of which is even more difficult to assess in wet conditions (because of the puddles).

These can be seen later because of the vehicle ahead of you. The resulting wetness also makes the braking distance longer.
1.1.03-119-M.text: Why is it necessary to maintain a larger safety distance to the vehicle ahead?

1.1.05-107-M.asw_2: That junctions will not be noticed
1.1.05-107-M.asw_3: That children may run onto the road
1.1.05-107-M.info:
In residential areas, there is always the risk that children may suddenly appear and run onto the road.

The straight road surface and a clear view through a lack of obstacles, e.g., parked vehicles, may lead to an increased driving speed.

The roadway and its surroundings increase the risk of overlooking junctions.
1.1.05-107-M.text: What must you be aware of here?

1.1.07-154.asw_1: In a tunnel with oncoming traffic, I position myself towards the right-hand edge of the roadway
1.1.07-154.asw_2: I memorise the safety features such as emergency exits and emergency telephones
1.1.07-154.asw_3: I drive with a reduced distance to the vehicle ahead, so that I can use its tail lights as a guide
1.1.07-154.info: The lights of oncoming traffic can dazzle and thus impair visibility. Therefore, it is safer to focus on the right-hand side of the road. Safety information must be observed in order to be able to react immediately in an emergency.
1.1.07-154.text: What should you do when driving through a tunnel?

1.1.09-024.asw_1: Because this reduces the field of vision
1.1.09-024.asw_3: Because this reduces the reaction time
1.1.09-024.info: Alcohol can reduce the field of vision even in small quantities. At the same time, it impairs spatial vision.
1.1.09-024.text: Why can fitness to drive be impaired even by just a small quantity of alcohol?

1.1.09-026.asw_1: - can result in my unfitness to drive
1.1.09-026.asw_2: - can result in an intoxication state lasting for several hours
1.1.09-026.info: Even the one-off use of drugs can have an immediate effect on the body and severely impair sensory perception. This makes the person concerned unfit to drive. The duration of this effect may be several hours or even longer.
1.1.09-026.text: Why is consuming drugs even just once, dangerous for driving on public roads?

1.1.09-027.info: The consumption of cannabis can be evident for several weeks after ingestion, e.g., through degradation products in the body.
1.1.09-027.text: How long does cannabis and its degradation products remain detectable in urine?

1.2.06-006.asw_1: - if it is clear that there is no oncoming traffic
1.2.06-006.asw_2: - so as not to impede the way of possible oncoming traffic
1.2.06-006.asw_3: - because any possible oncoming traffic must already be waiting
1.2.06-006.info: It is necessary to switch to the lane of oncoming traffic. If you want to drive past a narrowing of the roadway, an obstacle on the roadway or a stopping vehicle on the left, you must allow oncoming vehicles to pass. In this case, wait to see if oncoming traffic is approaching. If there is no oncoming traffic, you may proceed.

1.2.09-130-M.info: If you want to turn, you must signal this clearly and in a timely manner by using the indicators. If you want to turn right, you have to position your vehicle as far to the right as possible. If you want to turn left, position your vehicle in the lanes as far to the left as possible up to the middle of the intersection. As this is a one-way street and thus there is no oncoming traffic, the leftmost lane should be used.
1.2.09-130-M.text: You want to turn left. What driving line should you maintain?

1.2.26-008-M.asw_2: - overtake the cyclist, because there is no oncoming traffic visible
1.2.26-008-M.asw_3: - only overtake the cyclist at a moderate speed
1.2.26-008-M.info: They are approaching a pedestrian crossing. You must not overtake.
1.2.26-008-M.text: What is correct in this situation?

1.2.34-005.text: Under what emergency numbers can you call the police and the emergency services in Germany?

1.3.01-058-M.asw_1: I have to allow the motorbike the right of way
1.3.01-058-M.asw_3: I have to signal a left-turn
1.3.01-058-M.info: When turning off, you cross the driving line of the approaching motorcyclist. He is driving on the priority road and thus has priority.
1.3.01-058-M.text: What is correct in this situation?

1.3.01-059-M.info: The other motorists must yield. The tractor must yield because it has to wait for the oncoming traffic on the priority road. The motorist driving the red car must yield because he or she wants to enter the priority road.

1.4.41-165.asw_2: - cross the lane marking in order to overtake
1.4.41-165.asw_3: - cross the lane marking if oncoming traffic permits this
1.4.41-165.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not cross the continuous line even partially.
1.4.41-165.text: What do you have to be aware of in this traffic situation?

1.4.41-166.asw_2: You may not cross the lane marking
1.4.41-166.asw_3: Parking is permitted if there is a clear space of at least 3 m between a parked car and the lane marking
1.4.41-166.info: Attention: The answers and the solution are correct! Anyone driving a vehicle may not cross the continuous line even partially. Anyone driving a vehicle may park on the lane if there is at least 3 m more lane between the parked vehicle and the lane boundary line. But: "... on this priority road ...", there is not a 3m lane that remains between the parking vehicle and the lane boundary.
1.4.41-166.text: What must you be aware of on this priority road?

1.4.41-167.asw_3: - only overtake, if I remain in the right-hand lane while doing so
1.4.41-167.info: Vehicles in the right-hand lane may cross the marking if this does not endanger traffic.
1.4.41-167.text: You want to overtake. What is the right thing to do?

1.4.42-145.asw_1: - cross the centre line in order to pass by the obstruction
1.4.42-145.asw_2: - cross the centre line in order to overtake
1.4.42-145.asw_3: - not cross the centre line if this would endanger other traffic
1.4.42-145.info: Crossing the marked centre line is permitted in order to overtake or to avoid obstacles – but only if there is no danger to other motorists.
1.4.42-145.text: What do you have to observe in a traffic situation like this one?

1.8.01-003.info: Serious offences will be punished with two points. The redemption of such points can take place after five years at the earliest.
1.8.01-003.text: When will offences carrying two points be deleted from the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders?

2.1.05-105-M.asw_1: Slow-moving vehicle on my side of the road
2.1.05-105-M.asw_2: Fast oncoming traffic cutting the corner
2.1.05-105-M.info: The bend is not visible, so special caution is required. An obstacle could be detected late, oncoming traffic could enter your lane completely or partially and wild animals could run across the road.
2.1.05-105-M.text: What should you anticipate in this situation?

2.1.06-017-M.asw_2: Because the maximum permitted speed is 80 km/h
2.1.06-017-M.info: There is a risk of a collision with an oncoming car in your own lane. Braking increases the time window so that the car can move into the lane.
2.1.06-017-M.text: Why must you slow down here?

2.1.06-018-M.asw_2: I drive as far to the right-side as possible
2.1.06-018-M.info: The overtaking passenger car has underestimated the situation. Since it has almost overtaken completely, your own speed should be reduced. This allows the red car to move in earlier. In addition, it is necessary to drive to the extreme right in order to create additional space.

2.1.07-111.asw_1: Because the other vehicle might continue moving
2.1.07-111.asw_2: Because the direction of the road ahead demands it
2.1.07-111.asw_3: Because a speed limit is visible
2.1.07-111.info: A car is approaching the road from the right. It is hard to tell whether the driver is going to brake or keep going. Therefore, it is important to keep a safe distance in order to be able to decelerate immediately or even initiate a hazard braking in the event of an emergency.
2.1.07-111.text: Why must you be ready to brake in this situation?

2.1.07-112.asw_1: Because I am badly visible to other road users
2.1.07-112.asw_2: Because the direction of the road ahead demands it
2.1.07-112.asw_3: Because I have to give right of way
2.1.07-112.info: A white car is approaching the road from the right. Due to the vegetation, the road is difficult to see, so the driver of the white car may not see your car in time. The aim is to reduce your speed and to keep a safe distance in order to be able to decelerate immediately in an emergency or even initiate an emergency-braking manoeuvre.
2.1.07-112.text: Why should you lower your speed now?

2.1.07-113-M.info: Two lanes are merging. The van has almost completely overtaken and has to merge. The zipper feed-in method shall be used. In order for the van to be able to merge safely, you must slow down.
2.1.07-113-M.text: What is the right course of action in this situation?

2.1.07-114-M.asw_2: - tractor will proceed onto the road
2.1.07-114-M.info: The tractor is approaching the junction at a relatively high speed. It's possible that the driver won't stop. The driver may keep going. The motorcycle in front may have to slow down due to the tractor.
2.1.07-114-M.text: What should you anticipate in this situation?

2.1.07-115.asw_1: I maintain my speed and continue driving as before
2.1.07-115.asw_2: I accelerate in order to create a large enough safety distance
2.1.07-115.asw_3: I brake briefly in order that that the driver behind will reduce his speed
2.1.07-115.info: You are driving at the maximum permitted speed. The red car drives close up, but this is no reason to drive faster or even slow down. Accordingly, the journey must be continued at the current speed.
2.1.07-115.text: What is the right course of action in this situation?

2.1.07-117-M.asw_2: To vehicles coming from the left
2.1.07-117-M.info: Before turning onto another road, the traffic occurring there must be taken into account. Accordingly, attention must be paid to vehicles coming from the left. They drive in the lane corresponding to the lane into which they want to turn. Additional attention should be paid to the motorcycle that is currently in the same lane.
2.1.07-117-M.text: What must you pay attention to when turning right?

2.1.07-119.asw_1: I brake as hard as possible
2.1.07-119.asw_2: I maintain my direction of movement
2.1.07-119.asw_3: I always take an evasive movement
2.1.07-119.info: In the event of an unavoidable collision, brake as hard as possible in order to reduce the extent of the collision. The direction of travel must be maintained, as avoidance could lead to collision with other motorists or obstacles (e.g., trees).
2.1.07-119.text: What should you do, if it is no longer possible to avoid a collision with wild animals?

2.1.07-210-M.asw_2: An obstacle situated around the corner
2.1.07-210-M.asw_3: Cross-wise moving traffic before the summit
2.1.07-210-M.info: The signage indicates a sharp left turn. Due to the hilltop and the bend of the road, it is not possible to see what is going on around the corner. There may be an obstacle there.

2.1.11-009-M.asw_1: I wait until I am able to overtake
2.1.11-009-M.asw_3: I sound my horn and flash my headlights persistently
2.1.11-009-M.info: You are not allowed to coerce the person ahead of you. It is necessary to continue driving and to wait until there is an opportunity to overtake.
2.1.11-009-M.text: The vehicle ahead has prevented you from overtaking for some time now. What is the right course of action?

2.2.09-004-M.asw_1: I stop at the farm track and wait
2.2.09-004-M.asw_2: I accelerate and swiftly take the turn
2.2.09-004-M.asw_3: I continue driving, because I cannot turn off the road here
2.2.09-004-M.info: The motorcyclist is overtaking in the left lane. To avoid a possible collision, stop and turn only after it has overtaken.
2.2.09-004-M.text: You want to turn left. What is the right course of action?

2.6.06-216.asw_1: In 200 m the width of the left-hand lane is going to narrow
2.6.06-216.asw_2: Including its exterior mirrors, my vehicle is wider than the width specified in the vehicle documents
2.6.06-216.asw_3: The left-hand lane is going to narrow for a distance of 200 m
2.6.06-216.info: The carriageway width is reduced. The traffic sign indicates the maximum width of the vehicle (including load and mirrors) that is permitted for the use of the left lane. The additional symbol indicates that the width of the road will decrease in 200 metres. The vehicle width indicated in the vehicle documents does not take the exterior mirrors into account.
2.6.06-216.text: What do you have to be aware of in this situation?

2.1.08-025.info: Driving line no. 3 correctly guides the vehicle to the motorway entrance. Lanes no. 1 and 2 will take you onto the motorway in the wrong direction.
2.1.08-025.text: You want to join the motorway. What driving line should you follow?

1.1.07-023.asw_2: - look very similar to conventional bicycles
1.1.07-023.asw_3: - be easily recognised due to their engine noise
1.1.07-023.info: Cyclists riding e-bikes often travel faster than cyclists riding traditional bicycles. This is why their speed is often underestimated. E-bikes and conventional bikes look almost identical, which makes it difficult to distinguish between them.
1.1.07-023.text: What should you note about electric bicycles (e-bikes) participating in road traffic?

1.1.09-028.asw_1: Because of the possibility of experiencing hallucinations
1.1.09-028.asw_2: Because it is possible to over-estimate personal capabilities
1.1.09-028.asw_3: Because of the possible sudden onset of fatigue
1.1.09-028.info: Crystal meth is a hard drug that can cause delusions. Consumers tend to overestimate their own performance ability. Consumption can result in sudden exhaustion.
1.1.09-028.text: Why is an individual unfit to drive after consuming the drug crystal meth?

1.2.07-116.asw_1: I refrain from turning right, and remain in my lane
1.2.07-116.asw_2: I steer clearly to the right, in order to create a space in the right-hand lane
1.2.07-116.asw_3: I wait until all the vehicles have passed by, and then I move into the right-hand lane
1.2.07-116.info: Initially, a lane change would be necessary, but the right lane is already completely occupied by vehicles. Accordingly, a right turn must be avoided. You must remain your in own lane even if this means a detour.
1.2.07-116.text: You want to turn right at the junction. What should you do?

1.2.19-115.asw_1: I wait in front of the level crossing
1.2.19-115.asw_2: I continue driving if there is no train in sight
1.2.19-115.asw_3: I switch on my hazard lights
1.2.19-115.info: Vehicles must wait in front of the St. Andrew's Cross when the barriers are lowered or closed.
1.2.19-115.text: You are approaching a rail crossing. The barrier begins to lower. What should you do?

1.2.20-107-M.asw_2: I drive past the tram on the right-side
1.2.20-107-M.asw_3: I overtake the tram on the left
1.2.20-107-M.info: When tram passengers are boarding or disembarking, they may only be passed on the right at walking speed and only at such a distance that there is no danger to passengers. The path of the tram passengers must not be obstructed. If necessary, anyone who drives a vehicle must wait. Because the tram stops and tram passengers may cross the lane, it is important to stay behind the tram.
1.2.20-107-M.text: What is the right course of action in this situation?

1.2.23-007.asw_1: I need to have a hands-free unit
1.2.23-007.asw_2: I may use the telephone without a hands-free unit, if the vehicle is parked in a suitable place, and the engine is fully switched off
1.2.23-007.asw_3: I may use the telephone without a hands-free, if the vehicle is moving at walking pace
1.2.23-007.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not use a mobile telephone or car telephone if the mobile telephone or the handset of the car telephone must be picked up or held for this purpose. This does not apply if the vehicle is stationary and the engine is switched off in the case of motor vehicles.
1.2.23-007.text: You want to make a telephone call while driving. What must you be aware of?

1.2.23-008.asw_1: The motor vehicle must be roadworthy
1.2.23-008.asw_2: The motor vehicle must be covered by liability insurance
1.2.23-008.asw_3: I must be the vehicle owner
1.2.23-008.info: Participation in public road traffic requires a roadworthy vehicle. Motorists must also possess vehicle liability insurance. Driving without insurance cover can be punished with a fine or even imprisonment.
1.2.23-008.text: You want to use a motor vehicle on public roads. What must you observe?

1.2.34-006.asw_2: The registration certificate Part I or the operating permit
1.2.34-006.info: You must give other participants and injured parties present at the scene of the accident your name and address and must present your driving licence and vehicle registration upon request.You must also provide information on your liability insurance to the best of your knowledge.
1.2.34-006.text: You are involved in an accident. What document must you present to the other person involved in the accident, if requested?

1.5.01-124.info: There is heavy traffic during rush hour. This results in more frequent acceleration and starting and thus causes higher fuel consumption.
1.5.01-124.text: You are driving through city traffic in rush hour. What are the effects of stop-and-go driving?

2.1.08-024-M.asw_1: - do not switch lanes, because the red car is already moving across
2.1.08-024-M.asw_2: - move into the middle lane, because my overtaking manoeuvre is complete
2.1.08-024-M.asw_3: - switch lanes so that I do not obstruct the yellow car
2.1.08-024-M.info: The red car is already moving into the middle lane. Accordingly, it is necessary to continue driving and not to change lanes.

2.1.10-003.asw_1: - have false expectations of the systems
2.1.10-003.asw_2: - pay too little attention to the traffic around him
2.1.10-003.info: Driver assistance systems can raise false expectations, so that motorists overestimate the possibilities of technology. There is a danger that motorists will rely on such systems too greatly and thus will not pay attention to the traffic situation sufficiently. There is also a threat of neglect of personal responsibility.
2.1.10-003.text: What is the potential risk when using driver assistance systems?

2.1.11-010.asw_1: I only drive off, once I have calmed down again
2.1.11-010.asw_2: I drive off, in order to distract myself from my anger
2.1.11-010.asw_3: I try to reach my destination quickly, so that I can calm down there
2.1.11-010.info: Anger can limit the ability to drive, so it is sensible to sit behind the steering wheel only after your anger is gone.
2.1.11-010.text: Right before you want to drive off, you got annoyed about something and have become very angry. What should you do?

2.1.11-011.asw_1: - to the next stopping place, in order to calm myself down
2.1.11-011.asw_2: - to my destination, so that I can recover my composure
2.1.11-011.info: The situation has caused an inner restlessness or even insecurity, which can impair the driver's abilities. An intermediate stop can help you to calm down and continue your journey safely afterwards.
2.1.11-011.text: You have just avoided a road traffic accident by performing an emergency braking manoeuvre. Your hands and knees are shaking. You are still far from your destination. What should you do?

2.1.11-012.asw_1: I drive with a lower level of concentration
2.1.11-012.asw_2: I will become tired more quickly
2.1.11-012.info: Long working days mean a lot of physical strain. Accordingly, a reduced ability to concentrate is possible. The previous strain can be exhaustive and thus lead to rapid fatigue.
2.1.11-012.text: What should you be aware of when driving a car after a long day's work?

2.1.11-132.asw_2: I accept the challenge, but without exceeding 50 km/h
2.1.11-132.asw_3: I get out and confront the driver
2.1.11-132.info: It would be wrong to be provoked and take unnecessary risks in road traffic. That is why it is best not to be disturbed in such situations.
2.1.11-132.text: At a red light in a built-up area, another driver apparently wants to provoke you into a street race. What should you do?

2.2.03-023.asw_1: - the stretch of road visible to me
2.2.03-023.asw_2: - half of the stretch of road visible to me
2.2.03-023.asw_3: - twice the stretch of road visible to me
2.2.03-023.info: Due to the good road surface and visibility, you may drive at a speed which allows braking within the visible distance.
2.2.03-023.text: You are driving on a good quality road in good visibility conditions. Within what distance must you be able to stop?

2.2.05-016-M.asw_1: I do not overtake yet, because the blue car could overtake
2.2.05-016-M.asw_2: I follow right behind the blue car if it overtakes
2.2.05-016-M.asw_3: I overtake all the vehicles in one overtaking manoeuvre
2.2.05-016-M.info: There is the possibility that the motorist driving the blue car also wants to overtake and is thus changing lanes. Accordingly, it is still necessary to wait and see in order to ascertain the situation.
2.2.05-016-M.text: You want to overtake. What should you do now?

2.2.05-017.asw_2: - overtake the tram on the right
2.2.05-017.asw_3: - overtake the tram on the left
2.2.05-017.info: Rail vehicles must be overtaken on the right. Only those who cannot do this because the tracks are too far to the right are allowed to overtake on the left. Railway vehicles may also be overtaken on the left in one-way streets. Due to the difficult space and visibility conditions in this case, no overtaking will take place for the time being.
2.2.05-017.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.2.18-015-M.asw_1: - drive as far to the left as possible
2.2.18-015-M.asw_2: - drive as far to the right as possible
2.2.18-015-M.info: On roads with at least two lanes for one direction, a rescue lane should be formed that is immediately available to rescuers and other emergency services.
2.2.18-015-M.text: What must you do when a traffic jam forms on this road?

2.2.22-123.asw_1: The vehicle manufacturer's roof load specifications in the operating manual
2.2.22-123.asw_2: The gross vehicle weight rating of my car
2.2.22-123.asw_3: The roof load specifications contained in the registration certificate Part I
2.2.22-123.info: Irrespective of how the load is transported, the permissible total mass must be observed. A permissible roof load is defined for each vehicle and must not be exceeded.
2.2.22-123.text: You want to transport your holiday luggage on the roof of your fully occupied car. What must you observe?

2.2.23-119.asw_1: The top of the head should be level with the upper edge of the head rest
2.2.23-119.asw_2: The spacing between the rear of the head and the head rests should be as small as possible
2.2.23-119.asw_3: The upper edge of the head rest should conjoin with the upper neck vertebra
2.2.23-119.info: Missing or incorrectly adjusted headrests mean an increased risk of injury in the event of an accident. Depending on the accident, severe neck and head injuries may occur.
2.2.23-119.text: What should be observed when positioning the head rests in your car?

2.6.01-003.asw_1: By looking at the inspection tag on the rear license plate
2.6.01-003.asw_2: By reading the entry made in the registration certificate Part I
2.6.01-003.asw_3: By reading the entry in the operating manual for my vehicle
2.6.01-003.info: The date for the next general inspection is entered in the vehicle registration document. It can also be read on the inspection sticker located on the rear license plate.
2.6.01-003.text: How can you tell when you need to bring your vehicle in for its next vehicle roadworthiness test?

2.6.02-036.asw_1: - carry the inspection report or confirmation in my vehicle, and have the registration in certificate Part I corrected if necessary
2.6.02-036.asw_2: - forward the inspection report or confirmation to the vehicle manufacturer
2.6.02-036.asw_3: - stick the inspection report or confirmation into the designated place in the registration certificate Part II
2.6.02-036.info: The driver of the vehicle is obliged to carry the inspection report so that it can be produced upon request. Alternatively, the vehicle documents must be corrected.
2.6.02-036.text: An inspection has been performed because of a technical modification made to your vehicle. What are you obliged to do?

2.6.03-112.asw_1: In the registration certificate Part I of my car
2.6.03-112.asw_2: In the registration certificate Part I of my trailer
2.6.03-112.info: Under point O.1, the permissible trailer load is to be taken from Part 1 of the vehicle registration document / the registration certificate.
2.6.03-112.text: You want to tow a brake-equipped trailer. Where can you find details or guidelines on the permissible towable mass of your car?

2.6.03-113.info: Information on the permissible drawbar load of a passenger car can be found in the operating manual. The information can also be found in Part I of the registration certificate.
2.6.03-113.text: You want to couple a trailer to your car. Where will you find details about the maximum permissible vertical loading of your car?

2.7.01-063.asw_3: To compensate for unfitness to drive
2.7.01-063.info: Driver assistance systems can increase road safety by, for example, warning the driver of a previously undetected hazard in a timely manner. They can also support the driver while driving.
2.7.01-063.text: How can driver assistance systems be helpful?

2.7.01-133.info: If the road is dirty, a lane departure warning system may no longer work correctly. The same danger can also arise if there are no road markings.
2.7.01-133.text: What can restrict the functionality of a lane departure warning system?

2.7.01-134.asw_1: The locations at which I can charge the vehicle
2.7.01-134.asw_2: What I have to do following an accident
2.7.01-134.info: As a driver of an electric car, it is important to know what possibilities are available on site to charge the vehicle's battery. It is also important to know what the range is and which factors influence it. Drivers of electric cars should know how to behave after an accident.
2.7.01-134.text: What information should you obtain before undertaking a journey with a purely electric vehicle?

2.7.01-135.asw_1: The availability of electric charging stations
2.7.01-135.asw_3: The influence of external ambient temperatures on the range
2.7.01-135.info: During longer journeys with a purely electric vehicle, the range of the battery will not be sufficient to reach the destination without interruption. Accordingly, it is important to know where the battery can be charged. The driver should also know the necessary battery charging time. It should also be known how extreme outside temperatures affect the range of the vehicle.
2.7.01-135.text: You are planning a longer journey with a purely electric vehicle. What should you be aware of?

2.7.01-136.asw_1: The charge time depends on the power supply
2.7.01-136.asw_2: Charging should only be performed with a charging cable approved by the manufacturer
2.7.01-136.asw_3: Charging is available at every filling station
2.7.01-136.info: The charging capacity of a power connection is decisive for the charging time of the battery. Only cables approved by the manufacturer should be used for charging.
2.7.01-136.text: What should you be aware of when charging purely electric vehicles?

2.7.01-137.asw_2: - do not have any direct exhaust emissions
2.7.01-137.info: Electric cars are significantly quieter due to their motors. Likewise, no direct pollutants are emitted during driving.
2.7.01-137.text: How is a purely electric vehicle different from a vehicle with a combustion engine?

2.7.01-138.asw_1: Pedestrians will not notice me or will do so later than usual
2.7.01-138.asw_2: Cyclist travelling ahead will turn left, without looking behind them
2.7.01-138.asw_3: Vehicles following behind will tailgate me
2.7.01-138.info: Due to the quiet operating noise, electric cars are only noticed later or not at all. The same also applies to cyclists who do not suspect a vehicle behind them as a result and thus turn without prior notice.
2.7.01-138.text: You are driving a purely electric vehicle in a residential area. What should you be aware of due to your lower engine noise?

2.7.02-033.asw_3: The fill level of the brake fluid is too low
2.7.02-033.info: A defective brake light switch, the fuse or contact could be the cause of the failure of the brake lights to function. It is also possible that the light source is defective.
2.7.02-033.text: The brake light of your vehicle is not working. What could be the cause of this?

2.7.06-110.info: Switching off the cruise control too late can result in too high a speed. There is a danger of driving too close to other motorists. There is a risk of too high a cornering speed. The maximum permissible speed may be exceeded.
2.7.06-110.text: What could happen if the cruise control system (speed limiter) is switched off too late?

2.7.06-111.asw_2: With maintaining an energy-saving driving style
2.7.06-111.asw_3: With maintaining the minimum distance to the vehicle ahead
2.7.06-111.info: The cruise control helps to keep the set speed constant. It can thus also reduce fuel consumption.
2.7.06-111.text: With what can a cruise control system (speed limiter) assist you?

2.7.06-112.asw_1: I must remain constantly attentive even when using the system for a longer period
2.7.06-112.asw_2: The system can be affected by heavy rain or snow fall
2.7.06-112.asw_3: Activating the accelerator or brake pedal can always override the system
2.7.06-112.info: The use of such a system requires attention from the driver so that he or she can react immediately in an emergency and, for example, increase the distance. Rain or snowfall can impair the technology. As soon as the brake or accelerator pedal is depressed, the pedal takes precedence and overrides the adaptive cruise control system.
2.7.06-112.text: What should I be aware of when using an adaptive cruise control system?

1.1.01-004.asw_1: - of the arrangement and the function of the controls
1.1.01-004.asw_pretext: It is possible that I do not know enough about the special aspects
1.1.01-004.info:
Motorists driving vehicles they are unfamiliar with may behave differently when braking and thus require increased caution.

Other centrifugal forces can also occur when driving through curves. Various types of operating equipment and different vehicle dimensions also require increased caution.
1.1.01-004.text: You are to drive a motor vehicle with which you are unfamiliar. Why do you have to be particularly careful to begin with?

1.1.01-113.asw_1: Failure to pay attention to other road traffic
1.1.01-113.asw_2: Driving too close to the vehicle in front
1.1.01-113.info:
If traffic is poorly observed, there is a risk that other road users or events may be detected too late or not at all.

If you drive too close to other vehicles on the road you risk not being able to decelerate fast enough in the event of an emergency, which could result in a collision.

An inappropriate speed usually means that the driver is travelling too fast. This entails several risks including a longer distance required in order to brake.
1.1.01-113.text: What is a frequent cause of serious accidents?

1.1.04-111.asw_2: I keep towards the right-hand edge of the carriageway
1.1.04-111.asw_3: I switch on my main beam lights
1.1.04-111.info:
A vehicle with its main beam switched on seems to be approaching in its own lane. Reducing the speed reduces the risk of a collision.

Orientation on the right-hand side of the road helps to hold the lane without having to look directly into the light source of oncoming traffic.
1.1.04-111.text: What should you do in this kind of visibility?

1.1.06-111.asw_1: - oncoming traffic is travelling faster than first thought
1.1.06-111.asw_2: - the overtaking distance is longer than first thought
1.1.06-111.asw_3: - oncoming traffic is travelling slower than first thought
1.1.06-111.info: There is a risk that the speed of oncoming traffic will be underestimated. This increases the risk of a collision. Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that any oncoming traffic will not be obstructed during the entire time that you are overtaking.
1.1.06-111.text: Why can it be dangerous to overtake even on clearly visible, straight roads?

1.1.07-155-M.asw_1: For the cyclist on the left
1.1.07-155-M.asw_2: For the cyclist on the right
1.1.07-155-M.info: The cyclist on the left can go straight ahead and cross the road. The intentions of the cyclist on the right are not yet clear. You have to watch out for both cyclists.
1.1.07-155-M.text: What must you watch out for now?

1.2.04-104.asw_2: It helps reduce the risk of accidents
1.2.04-104.info: If you drive at a sufficient distance, you will be able to better understand the traffic situation and thus practise a far-sighted driving style. A sufficient distance guarantees an adequate reaction time (e.g., for braking), which reduces the risk of accidents.
1.2.04-104.text: What benefit can be obtained by maintaining an adequate distance between you and the vehicle ahead?

1.2.09-131-M.info: It is important to stay behind the cyclist. Otherwise the cyclist could be cut off potentially resulting in a collision.
1.2.09-131-M.text: The cyclist wants to continue straight ahead. What is the right course of action here?

1.2.12-122.asw_1: If there is an adequately paved hard shoulder to the right of the road lane
1.2.12-122.asw_2: If there are rails integrated into the road lane
1.2.12-122.asw_3: If there is a suitable parking lane to the right of the road lane
1.2.12-122.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not park on the road if there is not a lane of at least 3 m between the parked vehicle and the lane boundary line. Any person driving a vehicle should not stop to the left of the continuous lane boundary line if there is a hard shoulder or special lane on the right. No stopping is permitted in the space required by railway vehicles.
1.2.12-122.text: When are you not allowed to park on the right-hand lane?

1.2.22-109.asw_1: My vehicle may not exceed the gross axle weight rating
1.2.22-109.asw_2: I have to use suitable equipment to prevent the load from shifting
1.2.22-109.asw_3: My vehicle may exceed the gross vehicle weight rating by a maximum of 5%
1.2.22-109.info: Exceeding the axle loads is not permitted because it significantly increases the risk of accidents. The weight of the load must be taken into account accordingly. Motorists are obliged to adequately secure the load against slipping. If the load slips, this could impair safety.
1.2.22-109.text: What do you have to make sure of regarding the load on your vehicle?

1.3.01-127-M.asw_1: The cyclist, me, the yellow car
1.3.01-127-M.asw_2: The cyclist, the yellow car, me
1.3.01-127-M.asw_3: Me, the cyclist, the yellow car
1.3.01-127-M.info: The cyclist continues because he is following the priority road and because he is riding ahead. I myself have priority over the yellow car because I am coming from the right.
1.3.01-127-M.text: In what sequence may each continue driving?

2.1.07-120-M.asw_1: - restore the safety distance by braking
2.1.07-120-M.info: The safety distance was shortened by the motorcycle changing lane. The prescribed distance can be restored by slowing your vehicle down.
2.1.07-120-M.text: The cruise control system of your motor vehicle is set to 130 km/h. What is the right course of action now?

2.1.08-026-M.asw_1: The yellow car exits the motorway
2.1.08-026-M.asw_3: The blue bus in front of me brakes due to a traffic jam
2.1.08-026-M.info: The yellow car brakes for no apparent reason. The driver probably saw the exit late and will thus cross into my lane.
2.1.08-026-M.text: What should you be prepared for now?

2.2.18-016-M.asw_1: I warn the driver by sounding my horn and flashing my lights
2.2.18-016-M.asw_2: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
2.2.18-016-M.info: The oncoming car is driving the wrong way on the motorway. I can draw the driver’s attention to this with horns and light signs. By driving as far to the right as possible, the risk of a collision is reduced. I must notify the police.
2.2.18-016-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.2.18-017-M.asw_1: I accelerate and merge in front of the truck
2.2.18-017-M.asw_2: I slow down and merge between the red car and the truck
2.2.18-017-M.asw_3: I slow down and merge after the yellow vehicle
2.2.18-017-M.info: Deceleration would make merging more difficult, as there are numerous vehicles on the left lane. That's why it is important to accelerate and merge in front of the truck.

2.2.18-018-M.asw_1: I move into the left-hand lane
2.2.18-018-M.asw_2: I watch out for oncoming vehicles
2.2.18-018-M.asw_3: I continue by driving on the hard shoulder
2.2.18-018-M.info: The barrier panel indicates one end of the lane. The arrows indicate that you have to change to the left lane. In case of heavy traffic, it is necessary to drive to the front and to use the zipper feed-in method .
2.2.18-018-M.text: You want to exit the motorway. What is the right course of action in this situation?

2.2.18-019.asw_1: - drive as far to the right as possible in the right-hand lane
2.2.18-019.asw_2: - drive as far to the left as possible in the left-hand lane
2.2.18-019.asw_3: - drive as far to the left as possible in the right-hand lane
2.2.18-019.info: If the traffic on motorways and extra-urban roads is congested with at least two lanes for one direction, vehicles must form a free lane in the middle of the directional lane for the passage of police and auxiliary vehicles, in the case of lanes with three lanes for one direction between the left and the middle lane. This behaviour is crucial for rescuers to get to the scene quickly.
2.2.18-019.text: What must you do if you find yourself in a traffic jam on motorways and on highways with two lanes travelling in the same direction?

2.2.21-121.asw_1: - the child safety locks on the rear doors
2.2.21-121.info: Activating the child safety lock ensures that the corresponding door can no longer be opened from the inside, thus protecting the child.
2.2.21-121.text: How can you prevent a child from opening a door while the vehicle is moving?

2.2.23-053.info: In the event of a change of residence, the licensing authority must be informed. The same obligation applies in the event of a change of name.
2.2.23-053.text: As the vehicle owner, what change must you report to the relevant licensing authority?

2.2.23-054.asw_1: - notify the licensing authority of the change in ownership
2.2.23-054.asw_2: - present the licensing authority with proof of the existence of liability insurance for the vehicle
2.2.23-054.asw_3: - generally arrange for a vehicle roadworthiness test to be performed at the time of the change of ownership
2.2.23-054.info: If a change occurs in the ownership of a vehicle, the previous owner must notify the registration authority immediately for the purpose of correcting the vehicle registration. In this case, the vehicle is to be reregistered. In order for the vehicle to remain registered, liability coverage must be proven.
2.2.23-054.text: You are the new owner of a licensed vehicle. What do you have to do?

2.2.34-001-M.asw_3: I take a photograph of the scene of the accident
2.2.34-001-M.info: The scene of the accident is well secured, emergency forces are on site and the speed has already been adjusted. Therefore, it is necessary to continue driving.
2.2.34-001-M.text: What is the right course of action in this situation?

2.5.01-119.info: Luggage that is transported inside the vehicle and not on the outside does not increase air drag. Accordingly, it makes sense to transport luggage in the boot. The same applies to storing luggage behind the front seats.
2.5.01-119.text: Where can you stow your baggage so that you do not increase your fuel consumption unnecessarily?

2.7.01-131.asw_3: - generally follows the track of the car
2.7.01-131.info: When turning off, a caravan can swing out, threatening a collision with passers-by or objects. Depending on the course of the road, there is a risk of cutting the curve, so that the caravan will protrude into the lane of oncoming traffic.
2.7.01-131.text: What is the effect of the cornering characteristics of a combination vehicle (car towing a caravan) when taking a turn?

2.7.01-139.asw_3: - multiple times at quick intervals and with maximum force
2.7.01-139.info: In the event of emergency braking, the brakes are suddenly applied with maximum force. The earlier the brakes are applied, the longer the usable distance for braking. Pedalling with maximum force is intended to ensure that the highest braking performance is achieved.
2.7.01-139.text: You are driving a motor vehicle fitted with anti-lock braking system (ABS). How do you achieve the shortest possible braking distance?

2.7.01-140.asw_1: - keep the vehicle in lane if the road markings are clear
2.7.01-140.asw_2: - not function if the road markings are poor
2.7.01-140.asw_3: - compensate for a lack of fitness to drive (e.g. tiredness)
2.7.01-140.asw_pretext: A lane assist system with corrective steer control can
2.7.01-140.info: If conditions are good, the lane assistant system can ensure that the vehicle does not leave the lane. However, such systems cannot be relied upon one hundred per cent, especially if the lanes are poorly marked.
2.7.01-140.text: A lane assist system with corrective steer control can help you when driving. What should you be aware of?

2.7.02-127.asw_1: The tyre tread can be damaged
2.7.02-127.asw_2: A heavy strain is exerted on the front axle mechanism
2.7.02-127.info: Steering at a standstill causes above-average wear of the tyre, which can even lead to tyre damage. At the same time, significantly higher forces act on the steering axle, which results in a heavy strain on the mechanics.
2.7.02-127.text: What is the impact on your vehicle if you operate the steering wheel while stationary?

2.7.04-001.asw_1: That I use engine oil that meets the vehicle manufacturer's specifications
2.7.04-001.asw_2: That I do not exceed the maximum fill level
2.7.04-001.asw_3: That I refill the engine oil while the engine is running
2.7.04-001.info: Only engine oil that meets the manufacturer's requirements must be refilled. Otherwise there may be a risk of engine damage. The maximum filling level must not be exceeded; otherwise there is a risk of engine damage.
2.7.04-001.text: What should I ensure when refilling with engine oil?

2.7.05-001.asw_1: - manufactured in 12th calendar week of the year 2017
2.7.05-001.asw_2: - manufactured in the 12th month (December) of the year 2017
2.7.05-001.info: The DOT marking is a four-digit sequence of numbers pressed into the side of the tyre, indicating the date of manufacture of the tyre. The last four digits represent the production week and year: "1217" - 12 represents the production week and 17 represents the production year 2017. DOT = Department of Transportation
2.7.05-001.text: What is the meaning of the date of manufacture "1217" specified on the tyre?

2.7.05-101.asw_1: The car jack may only be applied at the positioning points specified by the vehicle manufacturer
2.7.05-101.asw_2: The ground surface must always be stable and skid-resistant
2.7.05-101.asw_3: The car jack must always be placed at the mid-point of the vehicle's length
2.7.05-101.info: To ensure that the vehicle is lifted safely, the jack may only be used at the attachment points specified by the manufacturer. Otherwise a secure hold is not certain, because parts of the car body could come loose and the vehicle could fall from the jack, for example. A loadable and non-slip surface is indispensable when jacking up the vehicle. Otherwise the jack could slip and the vehicle could fall down.
2.7.05-101.text: What should be noted when changing a tyre using a car jack?

2.7.05-102.asw_1: Secure the vehicle against rolling away, position the car jack, loosen the wheel nuts, jack up the vehicle, remove the wheel nuts
2.7.05-102.asw_2: Secure the vehicle against rolling away, position the car jack, jack up the vehicle, loosen the wheel nuts, remove the wheel nuts
2.7.05-102.asw_3: Position the car jack, secure the vehicle against rolling away, loosen the wheel nuts, jack up the vehicle, remove the wheel nuts
2.7.05-102.info: Initially, the vehicle must always be secured against rolling away, and then the jack can be attached. The wheel nuts are loosened before lifting the vehicle. Then lift the vehicle and unscrew the nuts completely.
2.7.05-102.text: You have to remove a defective tyre. In what sequence should you proceed?

2.8.01-012.asw_1: The driving licence authority may withdraw the application inspection order
2.8.01-012.asw_2: A test may be ordered to ascertain your aptitude for driving motor vehicles
2.8.01-012.asw_3: No consequences, as long as you are registered with a driving school
2.8.01-012.info: The person is already in training and should know that he or she is not allowed to drive a vehicle without a driving licence. This raises doubts as to his or her suitability for driving, and thus, the driving licence may be denied.
2.8.01-012.text: What should a driving licence applicant anticipate if he is found driving without a licence?

1.1.02-114.asw_1: - will run onto the carriageway, pulling the child behind it
1.1.02-114.asw_2: - will break free and the child will run after it
1.1.02-114.asw_3: - will be kept securely under control by the child
1.1.02-114.info: There is a risk that the child is not strong enough to keep the dog under control. Thus, the dog could tear away with the child running after it. The dog could also run onto the road and pull the child behind it.
1.1.02-114.text: What should you anticipate in this situation?

1.1.03-006-M.asw_1: A vehicle coming from the right
1.1.03-006-M.info: To the right, the road is difficult to see. That is why a vehicle could be approaching from the right. Moisture and leaves can impair traction and thus increase the braking distance. The roadway narrows (see traffic signs).
1.1.03-006-M.text: What must you be prepared for here?

1.1.07-156-M.asw_1: I perform an emergency braking manoeuvre
1.1.07-156-M.asw_2: I hold the steering wheel straight and firmly
1.1.07-156-M.info: A dog runs onto the roadway from the right. To avoid a collision, emergency braking is necessary.The vehicle must be driven straight ahead to avoid a collision with the truck or to avoid leaving the roadway.This question must not be confused with question 1.1.07-150. There, the distance to the dog is shorter and a vehicle is close behind.

1.1.09-029.asw_2: By drinking two cups of coffee
1.1.09-029.info: A short-term and thus quick restoration of your driving ability is not possible after considerable alcohol consumption. Neither coffee, walking nor a short sleep will help.
1.1.09-029.text: How can your fitness to drive be quickly restored following the excessive consumption of alcohol?

2.1.07-121-M.info: There is an obstacle on the road. To avoid it, however, would be risky, partly because oncoming traffic is approaching. Therefore you are not allowed to make an evasive movement. The only way out in this situation is to slow down immediately.

2.2.09-101.asw_1: - ensure the road area is safe by additionally looking all around me

2.2.09-101.info: When reversing, the driver must behave in such a way as to avoid endangering other motorists. Due to the limited visibility, attentive and slow driving is required. The motorist should primarily look behind the vehicle, but he or she should also look to the side and to the front of the vehicle for protection.

2.2.23-120.asw_1: When the telephone conversations are stressful
2.2.23-120.info:
Even with a hands-free system, difficult telephone conversations can arouse emotions and thus negatively influence driving behaviour.

At the same time, there is the risk of paying too much attention to the conversation and thus losing sight of the traffic situation. Complicated traffic situations, such as heavy traffic or slippery roads, require the driver's full attention.

Do not speak on the phone if doing so distracts you from driving.

Maintaining the correct tyre pressure significantly contributes to a long service life of the tyres.

Anticipatory driving avoids unnecessary braking or acceleration, thereby reducing tyre abrasion.

The oil supports cleaning, especially when changed regularly,by removing particles.

Rear fog lamps may only be used when the visibility due to fog is less than 50 m. Thus, switching on the fog lamps is permitted in this situation.

1.2.05-123.info: Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists. The hand signals used by the driver of the horse-drawn carriage must be observed, as they can signal a change in the direction of travel.

1.2.05-124.info: StVO 5 Abs. 4:"When overtaking, a sufficient lateral distance to other road users must be maintained. When overtaking on foot, by bicycle or by a small electric vehicle, sufficient lateral distance must be at least 1.5 m in towns and at least 2 m outside towns.

1.2.16-002.info: In certain situations, the hazard warning light must be switched on. If a multi-lane vehicle stops at a point where it cannot be detected in time as a stationary obstacle, hazard lights must be switched on immediately. When being towed, both vehicles must switch on the hazard warning lights. Anyone operating a regularly scheduled bus or a marked school bus must switch on hazard warning lights when approaching a bus stop and while passengers are boarding or alighting, provided that the authority responsible for road traffic under national law (road traffic authority) has ordered such behaviour for certain bus stops.

Anyone driving a vehicle may only drive over marked protective strips for cyclists if necessary. Cyclists must not be endangered.

Parking or holding is not permitted on the protective strip.

1.5.01-016.info:
All three answers are correct.

Carburettors or fuel injection systems require regular maintenance to prevent high fuel consumption and excessive emissions. The same applies to the air filter and the ignition system.
1.5.01-016.text: What can regular vehicle maintenance help achieve?

1.5.01-125.asw_1: Checking the tyre inflation pressure regularly
1.5.01-125.info: Regular vehicle maintenance, e.g. carburetor, fuel injection system, air filter and ignition system, is a prerequisite for environmentally friendly and energy-saving driving.Incorrect tire inflation pressure can lead to higher fuel consumption.
1.5.01-125.text: What is a pre-condition for environmentally-friendly and energy-saving driving?

1.5.01-126.info: Fuel consumption is lower at low rpm, so avoid high engine speed, drive in a high gear and do not accelerate strongly.
1.5.01-126.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. What style of driving results in higher fuel consumption within a built-up area?

1.5.01-127.asw_1: By switching early up to the next gear
1.5.01-127.asw_2: By employing an anticipatory driving style, to avoid frequent changes of speed
1.5.01-127.asw_3: By driving at a high engine speed
1.5.01-127.info: Shifting up early and driving in the highest gear possible reduces fuel consumption. A proactive driving style also contributes to low fuel consumption.
1.5.01-127.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. How can you reduce the fuel consumption of your vehicle?

1.5.01-128.asw_1: By driving at a low engine speed
1.5.01-128.asw_2: By using tyres that have a low rolling noise
1.5.01-128.asw_3: By removing the air filter insert
1.5.01-128.info:
Driving at low revs reduces vehicle noise.

Special low-noise tires also contribute to noise reduction.
1.5.01-128.text: How can you reduce the noise generated by your motor vehicle?

1.5.01-129.asw_1: - have the motor vehicle inspected if the exhaust is emitting an excessive amount of smoke
1.5.01-129.asw_2: - switch off the engine if waiting for longer periods
1.5.01-129.asw_3: - avoid unnecessary driving back and forth
1.5.01-129.info:
Strong exhaust smoke indicates a defective exhaust system that releases pollutants unnecessarily. Repair is required. The engine is not required for longer waiting periods; it should be switched off in this case.

Unnecessary driving back and forth unnecessarily pollutes the environment.
1.5.01-129.text: What should you do to help protect the environment?

1.5.01-130.info:
Unnecessarily fast acceleration is a noise nuisance that should be avoided. Damaged mufflers also generate unnecessary noise.

Driving fast in low gears means high engine speed and thus avoidable noise pollution.
1.5.01-130.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. When driving, what can cause avoidable noise pollution?

1.5.01-131.asw_1: Changing up gears as early as possible
1.5.01-131.asw_2: Changing down again as late as possible
1.5.01-131.asw_3: Drive until the upper engine speed range is reached in one gear, before changing up
1.5.01-131.info: Changing to a higher gear early helps to reduce fuel consumption. Shifting the gear down late has a similar effect, as high speeds are also avoided.
1.5.01-131.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox on a level carriageway. How should you change gears so as to drive in a particularly environmentally conscious and economical way?

1.5.01-132.asw_2: Frequently pressing the accelerator while waiting at traffic lights
1.5.01-132.asw_3: Driving downhill in a high gear
1.5.01-132.info: Playing with the accelerator while waiting at the traffic light results in unnecessary fuel consumption. A hectic, uneven driving style also increases fuel consumption.
1.5.01-132.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. What type of behaviour pollutes the environment?

1.5.01-133.asw_1: By having the proper tyre inflation pressure
1.5.01-133.asw_2: By adopting an even driving style with low engine speeds
1.5.01-133.asw_3: When accelerating, changing the gears upwards as late as possible
1.5.01-133.info: A balanced driving style at low revs contributes to low fuel consumption and emissions. The right tyre pressure also contributes to low fuel consumption and emissions.
1.5.01-133.text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. How can you achieve efficient fuel consumption?

1.5.01-134.asw_1: - drive off as promptly as possible
1.5.01-134.asw_3: - if possible, allow the engine of the stationary vehicle to warm up
1.5.01-134.info: After the engine has been ignited, the vehicle should be started immediately to avoid unnecessary engine operation. Driving at low revs contributes to low fuel consumption.
1.5.01-134.text: What should you consider after starting your vehicle?

2.1.01-007-M.asw_1: I reduce my speed so that the overtaking vehicle can pull in ahead of me

I let the overtaking vehicle get into the lane in front of me to avoid a dangerous situation.Then my safety distance is no longer sufficient. Therefore, I reduce my speed to create the necessary safety distance again.

2.1.01-103.asw_1: A service brake that responds heavily on one side
2.1.01-103.asw_2: An excessive amount of play in the steering
2.1.01-103.info:
All three answers are correct.

If the brake is heavily engaged on one side, the driving stability is endangered.

Too much play robs the steering of its precision. Such precision is necessary to safely drive the vehicle. In addition, driving straight is no longer guaranteed.

A non-functioning headlamp makes my vision difficult and I am perceived less well by other road users.
2.1.01-103.text: What can create a hazard when driving?

2.1.03-034.asw_1: Reduced ability to steer the vehicle
2.1.03-034.info: With aquaplaning, the tyres lose direct contact with the road surface, which means that the vehicle can no longer be steered and braked in a controlled manner. Due to the severely limited manoeuvrability, the vehicle may deviate from the road surface.
2.1.03-034.text: What can be the effect of aquaplaning?

2.1.07-010-M.info: All three answers are correct.Pedestrians are always to be expected in parking and rest areas.You must also always expect to see trucks parked incorrectly and vehicles leaving the parking area.

2.1.10-006.asw_1: I interrupt the journey to take an adequate break

2.1.10-006.info: In the case of fatigue, only recovery helps. The body must be given an appropriately long break.

2.1.11-013.asw_1: - exhibits a calm and relaxed driving style

2.1.11-013.asw_3: - always informs other traffic participants of their driving errors

If the motor fails, the brake booster is not available. In order to achieve a comparable braking force, applying a higher pedal pressure is necessary. Towing by means of a tow bar creates a connection that acts between the vehicles in both directions and thus provides some support during braking.

If an electric vehicle is towed, the manufacturer's instructions must be observed.
2.2.15-114.text: Your car has an engine fault and must be towed away with a tow rope. What must you be aware of?

2.2.17-012.info: The headlights must be switched on.Driving with the parking light alone is not allowed. In case of oncoming traffic, the high beam must always be switched off immediately.

This does not apply if the vehicle is stationary and the engine is switched off in the case of motor vehicles. Operation of the device may create a distraction that could endanger road safety.

2.5.01-012.asw_1: Motor vehicles with a green particulate emissions sticker
2.5.01-012.asw_3: Motor vehicles that meet the requirements for a green particulate emissions sticker, even if no such sticker is attached
2.5.01-012.info: Motorcycles do not need an environmental sticker. Only four-wheeled vehicles need a sticker and are allowed to enter the environmental zone with a green particulate matter sticker.
2.5.01-012.text: What motor vehicles may enter an environment zone that has this sign?

2.5.01-121.asw_1: Attending a practical driving training session for a fuel-efficient driving style
2.5.01-121.asw_2: Using vehicles with an electric drive
2.5.01-121.info: All three answers are correct.All measures that reduce pollutant emissions contribute to environmentally friendly driving.
2.5.01-121.text: What can contribute to environmentally-friendly driving?

2.5.01-122.asw_1: Do not press down hard on the accelerator when moving off
2.5.01-122.asw_2: Use the eco mode when driving
2.5.01-122.asw_3: Switch off the engine when driving down a gradient
2.5.01-122.info:
During "kick down", the engine shifts down and accelerates at maximum speed, which increases fuel consumption enormously. Therefore, avoiding "kick downs" is considered fuel-efficient.

If the engine of a car with automatic transmission is switched off while driving, transmission damage may occur.
2.5.01-122.text: How can you save fuel if you drive a car with an automatic gearbox?

2.6.03-114.asw_1: - towable weight of the towing vehicle
2.6.03-114.info: All three answers are correct.The maximum trailer load and the permissible drawbar load of the trailer coupling are entered in the vehicle registration document or in the registration certificate of the towing vehicle. These values must not be exceeded.
2.6.03-114.text: You want to pull a trailer. What must you be aware of?

2.6.07-101.asw_1: - applicable conditions for inner city road use (a city toll for example)
2.6.07-101.asw_2: - labelling requirements for driving in environment zones
2.6.07-101.asw_pretext: When abroad, there may be different
2.6.07-101.info: All three answers are correct.Speed restrictions, environmental zones and city tolls are regulated very differently abroad. A violation can lead to sometimes drastic fines.
2.6.07-101.text: What must you be aware of when route planning abroad?

2.7.01-065.asw_1: Wearing a suitable crash helmet is mandatory
2.7.01-065.asw_2: Quads are prone to tipping over when driving through tight bends
2.7.01-065.asw_3: The handling characteristics are similar to those of a car
2.7.01-065.info: The driving characteristics of a quad bike do not correspond to those of a car in many areas.Since one cannot "lay" oneself with Quads, contrary to the motorcycle, into the curve, there is the danger of "tilting" outward by centrifugal force.Wearing a protective helmet is mandatory.STVO §21a, 2:Anyone who drives motorcycles or open three- or multi-wheeled motor vehicles with a maximum design speed of over 20 km/h as well as riding on or in them must wear a suitable safety helmet while driving.This does not apply if mandatory safety belts are worn.
2.7.01-065.text: What must you be aware of when driving a quad?

2.7.01-066.asw_1: Protective motorcycle clothing should be worn
2.7.01-066.asw_2: A warning triangle must be carried on the quad
2.7.01-066.asw_3: The necessary steering force can be significantly greater than with a car
2.7.01-066.info: All three answers are correct.A first aid kit (§ 35h StVZO) and a warning triangle (§ 53a StVZO) must be carried.Since there is usually no power steering, the steering forces can be much higher than in a car.
2.7.01-066.text: What should be observed when driving a quad?

2.7.01-143.asw_1: My vehicle is getting close to the road markings at the side of the road
2.7.01-143.asw_2: My vehicle is undercutting the safety distance to the vehicle ahead
2.7.01-143.asw_3: Another vehicle is overtaking me with not enough side clearance
2.7.01-143.info: Lane Keeping Assistant is a driver assistance system that warns the driver of a vehicle before leaving the lane. It does not react to the lateral distance to other vehicles.The safety distance to the vehicle in front is controlled by the Distance Measurement Assistant.
2.7.01-143.text: The lane keeping assist system warns you with acoustic, haptic or optical signals. What might be the cause of this?

2.7.02-034.asw_1: I shut down the engine immediately
2.7.02-034.asw_2: I check the engine oil level
2.7.02-034.asw_3: I continue driving until the next oil change
2.7.02-034.info: The oil pressure indicator light warns the driver if the oil pressure is too low. This can lead directly to engine damage. The engine must be switched off immediately and the oil level must be checked.
2.7.02-034.text: What must you do if the oil pressure warning light fails to switch off after starting the engine?

2.7.02-128.asw_1: If the brake control light illuminates while driving
2.7.02-128.asw_2: If my car fails to stay in line when I brake
2.7.02-128.asw_3: If I performed an emergency braking manoeuvre with my car
2.7.02-128.info: The lighting up of the brake indicator light and one-sided braking (vehicle does not stay on track when braking) require the brake system to be checked.
2.7.02-128.text: When should you arrange for the braking system of your car to be checked?

2.7.03-102.asw_1: - drive in a low gear without pressing the clutch if at all possible
2.7.03-102.asw_3: - drive slowly with the clutch slipped
2.7.03-102.info: The less the clutch is actuated, the less wear and tear.Repeated starting and stopping puts a strain on the clutch.
2.7.03-102.text: You are in a traffic jam, driving at walking speed. When is the least wear exerted on the clutch of your manual transmission vehicle?

2.7.04-101.asw_pretext: Depending on the motor vehicle, by checking the
2.7.04-101.info: Depending on the vehicle, the engine oil level can be checked at the driver information system or the Oil Dipstick.
2.7.04-101.text: How can you check the engine oil level?

1.1.03-121.asw_3: I reduce the safety distance to the vehicle ahead
1.1.03-121.info: Heavy rain worsens visibility and grip. I therefore reduce my speed and avoid accelerating hard.Reducing the safety distance to the vehicle in front is therefore exactly the wrong thing to do.
1.1.03-121.text: While driving, it suddenly begins to rain heavily. What should you do?

1.1.06-130.asw_1: - estimate the distance away of an oncoming vehicle as being too great
1.1.06-130.asw_2: - estimate the speed of an oncoming vehicle as being too low
1.1.06-130.asw_3: - estimate my overtaking distance to be shorter than it is
1.1.06-130.info:
Because the vehicle to be overtaken is also in motion, the overtaking distance is often underestimated. The distance to oncoming traffic is also often overestimated.

Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that any oncoming traffic will not be obstructed during the entire time that you are overtaking.
1.1.06-130.text: Why can it be dangerous to overtake on an unobscured, straight road?

1.1.07-161-M.asw_1: I allow the red vehicle to turn
1.1.07-161-M.asw_2: I allow the electric scooter to cross the road
1.1.07-161-M.asw_3: I am the first to cross over the junction
1.1.07-161-M.info: If you want to turn, you have to yield to oncoming vehicles, rail vehicles, electric bicycles and cyclists even if they are riding or driving on or beside the road in the same direction. This also applies to scheduled buses and other vehicles using marked special lanes. Special consideration must be given to pedestrians. If necessary, wait.
1.1.07-161-M.text: You want to continue driving straight ahead. What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.1.07-162-M.asw_3: - drivers give my priority in re-joining the road
1.1.07-162-M.asw_pretext: When they approach me from the rear
1.1.07-162-M.info: Vehicles parked in a row can impair visibility. Vehicles that leave the parking row may not be recognised by other motorists until later. On the other hand, i.e., when leaving the parking space, visibility may be impaired, making it difficult to detect approaching traffic early.
1.1.07-162-M.text: I want to re-join the road. What is the correct assessment of this situation?

1.1.07-163.asw_3: Because the traffic movement situation is unclear
1.1.07-163.info: The traffic situation is unclear.Therefore, all three answers are correct.
1.1.07-163.text: Why is it dangerous to carry on driving past this accident scene?

1.2.05-125-M.asw_1: The incline causes the cyclists to sway
1.2.05-125-M.asw_2: I must overtake with at least 1.5 m of side clearance
1.2.05-125-M.asw_3: I must overtake with at least 1.0 m of side clearance
1.2.05-125-M.info: On the houses and in the rear view mirrors you can see that it is a relatively steep slope. The cyclists can therefore "swing" to the left and right.StVO § 5.4 Overtaking "... When overtaking, a sufficient lateral distance to the other road users must be maintained. When overtaking with motor vehicles of pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns and at least 2 m outside towns. ..."If cyclists are overtaking in built-up areas, the distance must be at least 1.5m.
1.2.05-125-M.text: What must you note when overtaking the cyclists in this situation?

1.2.11-114-M.asw_1: Only once the truck driver has used a hand signal to clearly indicate he is foregoing his right of way
1.2.11-114-M.asw_2: Only if I do not endanger or significantly impede the cross traffic
1.2.11-114-M.asw_3: Immediately, because the truck driver is prompting me to do that
1.2.11-114-M.info: I can't leave right away if a truck driver asks me to. First of all I have to make sure that I do not endanger or significantly obstruct cross traffic.If the truck driver then clearly gives up his right of way, I turn in front of him.
1.2.11-114-M.text: When may you take the turn?

1.2.37-020-M.asw_1: I initially halt at the stop line
1.2.37-020-M.asw_2: I ensure that other road users are not impeded
1.2.37-020-M.asw_3: Without stopping, I take the turn at walking speed
1.2.37-020-M.info: A single-field signal transmitter with a green arrow indicates that when the red light applies to the straight-ahead direction, it is permissible to turn to the right. Nevertheless, it is important to stop and consider that lateral traffic, cyclists and pedestrians have priority.
1.2.37-020-M.text: You now want to turn right at these traffic lights with a green arrow sign. What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-060-M.asw_2: The yellow car has to wait
1.3.01-060-M.info: Attention, this is not a roundabout, but a so-called " unreal roundabout".It is not marked by the traffic signs "Give way" and "Roundabout". Here, as at a normal intersection, the basic rule "right before left" applies. The indicator must therefore also be activated when entering and leaving the roundabout.
1.3.01-060-M.text: What is the right thing to do?

1.4.40-011.asw_1: - drive up to the pedestrian crossing at a moderate speed
1.4.40-011.info: The danger sign warns of a dangerous place by a crosswalk. This crosswalk can be difficult to recognize.Therefore, all three answers are correct.
1.4.40-011.text: What must you do upon seeing this traffic sign?

2.1.03-119.asw_1: The functionality of the ACC may be negatively affected
2.1.03-119.asw_2: I have to personally control my speed and distance
2.1.03-119.info: The use of such a system requires attention from the driver so that he or she can react immediately in an emergency and, for example, increase the distance. Rain or snowfall can impair the technology. As soon as the brake or accelerator pedal is depressed, the pedal takes precedence and overrides the adaptive cruise control system.
2.1.03-119.text: While driving, you use your vehicle’s adaptive cruise control (ACC) system. What must you anticipate in these weather conditions?

2.1.03-120.asw_1: - be able to stop within half of the distance visible to me
2.1.03-120.asw_2: - stop for oncoming traffic, if necessary
2.1.03-120.asw_3: - anticipate unevenness at the edge of the road caused by tree roots
2.1.03-120.info: Avenues are often narrow, which can lead to conflicts with oncoming traffic. Due to the narrow tree planting unevenness of the road surface may occur, which can be due to the roots of the trees. In principle, you may only drive so fast that it is possible to stop within sight at any time. However, in lanes that are so narrow that oncoming vehicles could be endangered, motorists must drive so slowly that at least half of the visible distance can be maintained.
2.1.03-120.text: You are driving along a narrow avenue. What must you be aware of?

2.1.05-009.asw_2: After a long journey at high speed
2.1.05-009.asw_3: On narrow roads with uneven road surfaces
2.1.05-009.info: On wide roads without edge development, the speed of a vehicle is often estimated to be too low. Prolonged driving at high speed has a similar effect.
2.1.05-009.text: In what situation does a driver frequently underestimate their own speed?

2.1.06-103-M.info: Although it is not allowed, the oncoming red car has crossed the double line. A collision is possible, you must switch to the right-hand lane.
