2.1.07-022-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

2.1.11-014-M.asw_2: I overtake, because the road is clear
2.1.11-014-M.asw_3: I close the distance and sound my horn
2.1.11-014-M.info:
The road is not sufficiently visible because of the curve, therefore it is not allowed to overtake.

Honk only who overtakes outside built-up areas or who sees himself or others endangered.

I therefore maintain my speed.
2.1.11-014-M.text: The red car in front of you has been driving slowly for some time now. What is the correct course of action in this situation?

2.1.11-015.asw_1: A lack of awareness of the road traffic
2.1.11-015.asw_2: A high readiness to take risks
2.1.11-015.info: Während nächtlicher Freizeitfahrten - insbesondere an Wochenenden - neigen einige junge Kraftfahrer zu einer hohen Risikobereitschaft. Als Folge wird oftmals mit überhöhter Geschwindigkeit gefahren.
2.1.11-015.text: What frequently causes young people to have “disco accidents”?

2.1.11-016.asw_2: - the driver frequently goes too fast
2.1.11-016.asw_3: - a defensive driving style is frequently adopted
2.1.11-016.asw_pretext: Because, when driving under pressure of time
2.1.11-016.info: Despite time pressure, the traffic rules must be observed.
2.1.11-016.text: Why can driving under pressure of time be dangerous?

2.1.11-133.asw_1: A lack of experience driving after dark
2.1.11-133.asw_2: Little experience with fully occupied vehicles
2.1.11-133.info: Fully occupied vehicles require corresponding experience from the driver. This is due to factors such as the influence of the fully occupied vehicle on driving behaviour as well as a possibly intensified distraction caused by the passengers. A lack of driving experience in darkness also increases the risk of accidents.
2.1.11-133.text: What frequently causes young people to have “disco accidents”?

2.2.14-107-M.info: Opening the door would endanger the cyclist riding on my side of the road, so I must not open the door now.The motorcycle and pedestrians would not be endangered by opening the door.
2.2.14-107-M.text: Why may you not exit now?

2.2.17-115.asw_1: The oncoming traffic may be dazzled by my dipped headlights
2.2.17-115.asw_2: My car's headlamp range may be too short
2.2.17-115.asw_3: The life-cycle of the light bulb for the headlights may be reduced
2.2.17-115.info: Adjusting the level of headlamps manually entails the risk of setting the level incorrectly. If the level is set too low, the road will be insufficiently illuminated. If set too high, there is a risk of dazzling oncoming traffic.
2.2.17-115.text: What can be the consequence of wrongly setting the headlamp levelling control?

2.2.18-021-M.asw_1: I stay in the middle lane
2.2.18-021-M.asw_2: I move into the left-hand lane
2.2.18-021-M.asw_3: I move into the right-hand lane
2.2.18-021-M.info: There is a vehicle next to me in the left lane and a motorcycle approaching from behind in the right lane that may overtake me on the right.I therefore stay in the middle lane.
2.2.18-021-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.2.18-104-M.asw_1: - warns of a possible collision with a vehicle in the middle lane
2.2.18-104-M.asw_3: - brakes the speed of my vehicle
2.2.18-104-M.info: Lane Change Assist (also: Blind Spot Assist) warns drivers of impending collisions when changing lanes. Here it warns of the vehicle in the middle lane. It does not change lanes on its own and does not brake automatically if the distance to the vehicle in front becomes too small.
2.2.18-104-M.text: How can lane changing assist help you in this situation without steering override?

2.2.23-123.asw_3: That the windscreen wipers are working properly
2.2.23-123.info: Incorrectly adjusted headlights can dazzle other road users, making it more difficult for them to see the course of the road and follow the traffic.Worn tires and tires with incorrectly adjusted air pressure have a greatly reduced grip on the ground, which results in longer braking distances, among other things.Clear visibility must be ensured at all times when driving.
2.2.23-123.text: You are planning a long journey with your motor vehicle. Before commencing the journey, what should you check on the vehicle to avoid endangering yourself and others?

2.4.41-004-M.asw_1: I move into the right-hand lane
2.4.41-004-M.asw_2: I only use the left-hand lane if there is a breakdown
2.4.41-004-M.asw_3: I remain in my current lane
2.4.41-004-M.info: The right-hand lane rule also applies on highways in a construction zone. I therefore switch to the right-hand lane.
2.4.41-004-M.text: You are driving on this motorway. What is the right course of action?

2.5.01-123.info: Vehicles with gasoline or diesel engines, require a fine dust sticker.Cars with electric motors that are clearly identifiable with an E license plate also require the fine dust sticker.
2.5.01-123.text: What cars that are driven within designated environmental zones must display a particulate matter sticker?

2.5.01-124.asw_1: The driver fails to detect signals from other traffic
2.5.01-124.asw_2: It causes a nuisance to other road users
2.5.01-124.info: Very loud music can annoy others even with the windows closed. At the same time, it can distract the driver and thus encourage driving errors. Noises from outside are not heard.
2.5.01-124.text: What can result from listening to very loud music while driving a car?

2.5.01-125.asw_3: The profile depth of the tyres
2.5.01-125.info:
Drags that occure while driving increase exponentially and not linearly with the increasing speed. Additional 30 km/h instead of 130 km/h can thus increase fuel consumption by up to 35 percent.

The weight and tread depth do not affect the fuel consumption of a vehicle as much.
2.5.01-125.text: Air resistance affects the fuel consumption of a vehicle. What affects air resistance the most?

2.5.01-126.asw_1: By using the automatic start-stop system
2.5.01-126.asw_2: By putting the vehicle in first gear
2.5.01-126.info: During waiting times, stopping the engine helps to relieve the burden on the environment and reduce fuel consumption.
2.5.01-126.text: You have to wait because a rail-crossing barrier is lowered. How can you now help protect the environment at this point?

2.7.01-144.asw_3: - in constricted roadworks sites with poor road markings
2.7.01-144.info: Lane Keeping Assist with steering intervention can only keep the vehicle in lane if the lane markings are good.It does not function reliably with poor lane markings.
2.7.01-144.text: In what situation can the lane keep assist system with steering override help you?

2.7.01-145.asw_1: When driving in a straight line
2.7.01-145.info: Lane Keeping Assist with steering intervention can only keep the vehicle in lane if the lane markings are good.It does not work reliably when the lane markings are poor, when turning or when overtaking.
2.7.01-145.text: With which driving task can the lane keep assist system with steering override help the driver?

2.7.01-146.asw_2: The condition of the road markings
2.7.01-146.asw_3: Additional road markings within a roadworks site
2.7.01-146.info: Lane Keeping Assist with steering intervention can only keep the vehicle in its lane if the lane markings are good.It does not function reliably if the lane markings are poor or unclear, e.g. in roadworks and in poor weather conditions that impair visibility.
2.7.01-146.text: What can negatively affect the functioning of the lane keep assist system?

2.7.01-147.asw_1: Where there are clear road markings
2.7.01-147.asw_2: Where there are patches of snow on the road surface
2.7.01-147.asw_3: Where there are additional roadworks markings
2.7.01-147.info: Lane Keeping Assist with steering intervention can only keep the vehicle in its lane if the lane markings are good.It does not function reliably if the lane markings are poor or unclear, e.g. in roadworks and in poor weather conditions that impair visibility.
2.7.01-147.text: Under what conditions will the lane keep assist system with steering override function optimally?

2.7.01-148.info: Brake Assist and Autonomous Emergency Brake Assist support the driver in a dangerous situation.The cruise control system supports the driver exclusively in maintaining a constant speed.
2.7.01-148.text: What driver assistance system offers a high degree of road safety potential?

2.7.01-149.asw_3: - intervene automatically in critical road traffic situations
2.7.01-149.text: How can driver assistance systems help you?

2.7.02-037.asw_1: The vehicle should be checked in a garage
2.7.02-037.asw_2: The handling of the vehicle could be negatively affected
2.7.02-037.asw_3: The tyre could have a slow puncture
2.7.02-037.info: After a collision with a solid obstacle, check whether the tyre or rim has been damaged. Damage could lead to a tyre bursting or a permanent loss of pressure.
2.7.02-037.text: One of your wheels has collided heavily against a kerb. What should you note?

2.7.02-038.asw_3: The main beam light switch is faulty
2.7.02-038.info: A blown fuse may be responsible for a failing taillight. But it is often possible that only the incandescent lamp is defective and must be replaced.
2.7.02-038.text: The tail light of your vehicle is not working. What could be the cause of this?

2.7.02-129.asw_1: - have my car inspected in a garage without delay
2.7.02-129.asw_2: - only continue driving at low speed
2.7.02-129.asw_3: - only use the handbrake from that time on
2.7.02-129.info: If your car pulls strongly to the left when braking, there may be a defect in the brake system. Your car must be checked at the workshop immediately.To avoid any risk, you must therefore continue to drive at a low speed.In many modern vehicles, the "hand brake" is a "parking brake" and blocks the rear wheels. The answer is therefore incorrect.
2.7.02-129.text: While driving, you notice that your car pulls heavily to the left when you brake. What is the right course of action?

2.7.02-130.asw_1: I arrange for my vehicle to be inspected by a garage without delay
2.7.02-130.asw_2: For the time being, I bear this steering behaviour in mind when continuing to drive
2.7.02-130.asw_3: I reduce the tyre inflation pressure on the front axle
2.7.02-130.info:
If the operation of the steering wheel requires an unusually high amount of force, the steering aid has probably failed. The steering gear may also be defective.

The vehicle must be checked immediately in a workshop.
2.7.02-130.text: Your vehicle is much more difficult to steer than usual. What is the right course of action?

2.7.02-131.info: All three answers have an impact on tire wear and are therefore correct.
2.7.02-131.text: You note that the tyres on your vehicle's front axle are showing uneven amounts of wear. What should be checked?

2.7.02-132.asw_1: I check the tyre inflation pressure and take the vehicle to a garage if necessary
2.7.02-132.asw_2: I simply note the steering behaviour when I continue driving
2.7.02-132.asw_3: I attempt to improve the handling by braking heavily
2.7.02-132.info: Improper tire inflation pressure, especially if it is one-sided, can greatly affect the handling of the vehicle.If the tire inflation pressure is not the cause, I drive to the workshop for inspection.
2.7.02-132.text: While driving, your vehicle pulls to the right. What is the right course of action?

2.7.02-133.info: Defects in the chassis or steering system can endanger driving safety and must be checked in a workshop.Damage to the paintwork is only a visual impairment.
2.7.02-133.text: When must you arrange for your car to be inspected by a garage?

2.7.02-134.asw_3: The hazard lights are switched on
2.7.02-134.info: If the bulb of the control light for an indicator is defective, the indicator lamp flashes much faster. The defective bulb must be replaced as quickly as possible.
2.7.02-134.text: The indicator light is flashing much faster than usual. What could be the cause of this?

2.8.01-013.asw_1: The withdrawal of their driving licence
2.8.01-013.asw_2: An extension of the probationary period by another 3 years
2.8.01-013.asw_3: An order to attend a driver fitness session
2.8.01-013.info: If the holder of a driving licence does not comply with the order to participate in an advanced seminar within the time limit, the driving licence will be withdrawn.
2.8.01-013.text: A learner driver has committed several violations during the probationary period. The authority has ordered that the driver attends a supplementary driving course. The learner driver fails to comply with this order. What can they expect to happen?

1.2.05-003.info:
Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists.

StVO §5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns  and at least 2 m outside towns."
1.2.05-003.text: When driving outside of a built-up area, you want to overtake cyclists or pedestrians. What is the minimum space to the side that you must maintain?

1.2.05-004.info:
Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists.

StVO §5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns  and at least 2 m outside towns."
1.2.05-004.text: Driving within a built-up area, you want to overtake a cyclist. What is the minimum space to the side that you must maintain?

1.2.05-005.info: StVO § 5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns and at least 2 m outside towns."
1.2.05-005.text: Driving within a built-up area, you want to overtake an electric scooter. What is the minimum space to the side that you must maintain?

1.1.07-164-M.info: On the bike path to my right, a cyclist is riding in the same direction as me and is currently in my "blind spot".When turning right, I would endanger the cyclist.
1.1.07-164-M.text: What must you watch out for when turning right here?

1.1.07-165-M.asw_2: I pass quickly through the junction
1.1.07-165-M.info: The motorcyclist coming from the left has not reduced his speed. He seems to want to cross the intersection immediately.To prevent an accident from occurring, I give up my right of way and perform hazard braking.
1.1.07-165-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.1.07-166-M.asw_1: The cyclist will pull out to the left
1.1.07-166-M.asw_3: The cyclist will dismount to allow me to pass
1.1.07-166-M.info: The cyclist will change lanes due to the parked cars. Due to the nearby curve, which is difficult to see, sudden oncoming traffic is to be expected.

1.1.07-167.asw_1: - I can be distracted by loud vehicle noise
1.1.07-167.asw_2: - the safety devices, like emergency exits and emergency telephones are signposted
1.1.07-167.asw_3: - I can be distracted by lighting effects
1.1.07-167.info: In a tunnel, the sound generated by vehicles echoes, which can result in a loud and possibly disturbing background noise. Safety information must be observed in order to be able to react immediately in an emergency. While driving in Light effects, for example, through the tunnel lighting may have a distracting effect.
1.1.07-167.text: You are driving through a tunnel. What special aspect applies here?

1.2.09-134-M.asw_2: I continue on the right-hand lane for now
1.2.09-134-M.asw_3: I move without delay into the left-hand lane
1.2.09-134-M.info: Although it is not permitted at this point, the motorcyclist overtakes me on the left.In order not to endanger the motorcyclist and to avoid an accident, I slow down and stay on the right lane for the time being.
1.2.09-134-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.2.09-135-M.info: The oncoming car in the opposite lane is driving straight ahead and has the right of way.I may only turn afterwards, if an obstruction of other road users (e.g. also pedestrians) is excluded.
1.2.09-135-M.text: Why are you not allowed to take the turn now?

1.2.34-114.asw_2: A withdrawal of the driving licence or a driving ban
1.2.34-114.asw_3: An order to undergo a medical/psychological examination
1.2.34-114.info: Under § 142 of the Criminal Code (StGB), hit-and-run offenders are punishable by up to 3 years' imprisonment or a fine.A driving ban or a medical-psychological examination can also be ordered.
1.2.34-114.text: A vehicle driver has slightly damaged another vehicle, and unlawfully leaves the scene. What consequence could this have?

1.3.01-039-M.info: The electric scooter is on the priority road and is driving straight ahead. The electric scooter drives first.

1.3.01-130-M.asw_2: The blue car has to wait
1.3.01-130-M.asw_3: I have to reach an understanding with the driver of the blue car
1.3.01-130-M.info: In this traffic circle the right of way is not regulated by a traffic sign, therefore the "right before left" rule applies.StVO § 8:(1) At intersections and junctions, whoever comes from the right has the right of way. This does not apply,1. if the right of way is specially regulated by traffic signs (signs 205, 206, 301, 306) or2. for vehicles coming from a field or forest path onto another road.(1a) If sign 215 (traffic circle) is placed below sign 205 (give way) at the entrance to a traffic circle, traffic on the circular roadway has the right of way. When entering such a traffic circle, the use of the direction indicator is not permitted.
1.3.01-130-M.text: Which is correct in this situation?

1.4.41-020-M.asw_1: - not drive on the restricted zone
1.4.41-020-M.asw_2: - use the restricted zone to make a turn
1.4.41-020-M.asw_3: - use the restricted zone if there is a traffic jam
1.4.41-020-M.info: Restricted areas are road markings that indicate that a certain area of the road may not be used by vehicles.StVO § 41
1.4.41-020-M.text: What is true in this situation?

1.4.41-170.asw_1: I must drive at a minimum speed of 60 km/h, if permitted by the road and traffic conditions
1.4.41-170.asw_2: I may only use this lane if my vehicle can and is allowed to drive at a speed of least 60 km/h
1.4.41-170.asw_3: I may not drive faster than 60 km/h
1.4.41-170.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not drive slower than the specified minimum speed, unless road, traffic, visibility or weather conditions oblige him or her to do so. If you cannot meet the minimum speed you cannot use the road.
1.4.41-170.text: This road traffic sign is displayed for your lane. What must you be aware of?

2.1.02-004.info: Pedestrians have priority over turning vehicles at intersections and junctions.This also applies to the runner currently obscured by the construction worker.StVO § 9:(3)Anyone who wants to turn must allow oncoming vehicles to pass, rail vehicles, bicycles with auxiliary motors, bicycles and miniature electric vehicles even if they are traveling on or next to the roadway in the same direction.This also applies to buses and other vehicles using designated special lanes.Special consideration must be given to pedestrians; if necessary, drivers must wait.
2.1.02-004.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.1.03-036.info: Rain and wet leaves can make roads dangerously slippery. Longer braking distances must be expected.The correct behavior is to reduce speed and avoid jerky steering.There is no reason for heavy braking and it would also be dangerous, as the vehicle could quickly start to slide.
2.1.03-036.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

2.1.07-015-M.asw_1: Because the red car could cross onto my lane
2.1.07-015-M.asw_2: Because other people may walk onto the road
2.1.07-015-M.asw_3: Because the blue car could continue moving
2.1.07-015-M.info: A vehicle in the oncoming traffic has stopped on the left lane. It is possible that other people may get out of the vehicle, which is why it is necessary to slow down. The red car that is approaching could overtake. That is why caution is called for.
2.1.07-015-M.text: Why should you further reduce your speed here?

2.1.07-023-M.info: There is a risk of collision with an animal, which can be avoided by braking in a timely manner.
2.1.07-023-M.text: Why should you reduce your speed now?

2.1.08-028-M.asw_2: I remain in the left-hand lane
2.1.08-028-M.info: The truck reduces its speed sharply because there is an object in its lane.I immediately reduce my speed, stay in my left lane and watch the truck. The truck may abruptly change to the left lane to avoid the obstacle.
2.1.08-028-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.1.08-029-M.info: The truck in front is changing lanes and is slower in comparison. It is necessary to slow down in order to adjust your own speed.
2.1.08-029-M.text: Why must you reduce your speed now?

2.1.08-030-M.asw_1: I use the speedometer to check my speed at short intervals
2.1.08-030-M.asw_3: I reduce my speed only once I am at the turn
2.1.08-030-M.info:
The motorway will be left via an exit. Driving at high speed for long periods of time can lead to the speed being underestimated. A look at the speedometer should ensure that the speed is already adjusted.

The speed should be reduced only on the exit lane, so as not to obstruct the flowing traffic.
2.1.08-030-M.text: You want to leave the motorway. What is the right course of action?

2.1.11-017.asw_1: I adjust my speed to that of the car
2.1.11-017.asw_2: I overtake at a suitable place
2.1.11-017.asw_3: I flash my headlights, until the car begins to drive faster
2.1.11-017.info: In order to avoid unnecessary danger, youmust adjust your speed. As soon as a safe opportunity presents itself, you may overtake.
2.1.11-017.text: You are on a road outside of a built-up area, and a car in front of you is driving much slower than is permitted to and has the capacity to. What is the right course of action?

2.2.02-101-M.asw_1: I wait until the works enable me to drive past
2.2.02-101-M.asw_2: I turn around and drive back
2.2.02-101-M.asw_3: I reverse back up the road
2.2.02-101-M.info: Reversing is only allowed in one-way streets for very short distances, e.g. for parking, and turning around in a one-way street is prohibited.So I wait until I can drive on.
2.2.02-101-M.text: What is the correct course of action on this one-way road?

2.2.03-024.info: You may drive at a speed which allows braking within the visible distance. If no other influences (e.g., the weather) impair visibility, this is determined by the headlights.
2.2.03-024.text: You are driving in darkness on a well-constructed main road, using your dipped headlights. Within what distance must you be able to stop?

2.2.07-012-M.asw_1: - must be used like a right-hand lane
2.2.07-012-M.asw_2: - may only be used in a breakdown situation
2.2.07-012-M.asw_3: - may only be used by trucks
2.2.07-012-M.info:
The traffic sign 223.1 "Seitenstreifen befahren" stipulates that the hard shoulder must be used as the right lane.

This applies to all vehicles, not just trucks.
2.2.07-012-M.text: What is true about using the hard shoulder in this situation?

2.2.12-107-M.asw_1: I forego the parking space, even though I have priority
2.2.12-107-M.asw_2: I park now, because I have priority
2.2.12-107-M.info: I can't park now because another vehicle is now in the parking space."I'll give up the parking space ..." is the right answer, even if it is difficult to accept.
2.2.12-107-M.text: You want to park on the right-hand edge of the road. What should you do in this situation?

2.2.12-108-M.asw_3: No one has priority. We have to agree
2.2.12-108-M.info: The blue car has priority, it was first at the parking space. By stopping and setting the turn signal, he clearly indicated that he wanted to drive into the parking space.
2.2.12-108-M.text: You want to park on the right-hand edge of the road. Who has priority in this situation?

2.2.15-115.asw_1: I have to switch on my hazard lights
2.2.15-115.asw_2: I have to place at least one well-visible warning sign about 100 m behind the vehicle
2.2.15-115.asw_3: I should wear a hi-vis vest
2.2.15-115.info:
Because the vehicle remains on the road, it poses a danger to other motorists. Other motorists must be warned of the danger by flashing a warning light. There is an obligation to put up a warning sign at a sufficient distance to warn the approaching traffic of the danger at an early stage. Standard values are:

  • inner city: 50 meters
  • country road: 100 meters
  • Freeway: 150 to 400 meters

Wearing a high-visibility vest is a safety measure that helps to improve visibility for other motorists.
2.2.15-115.text: You experience a breakdown outside of a built-up area. Your car is situated on the carriageway, behind a bend in the road. Which is correct in this situation?

2.2.16-101.asw_1: - experiences a breakdown at a place where the view is obscured
2.2.16-101.info: If a multi-lane vehicle comes to a standstill in a place where it cannot be recognized in time as a stationary obstacle, the hazard warning lights must be switched on immediately. This also applies to vehicles that are being towed away.The purpose of the hazard warning lights is to ensure that the vehicle is recognized as an obstacle in good time by other road users.
2.2.16-101.text: When must you switch on the hazard lights on your vehicle?

2.2.23-124.asw_3: - replaces the seatbelt in the rear seats
2.2.23-124.info: Head restraints are part of a vehicle's passive safety system and significantly increase occupant safety.In the event of a collision, especially a rear-end collision, the head restraint reduces the risk of injury to the cervical spine.
2.2.23-124.text: What is the main function of the headrest in a car?

2.2.34-101.asw_1: I secure the scene of the accident
2.2.34-101.asw_3: I load the animal into my vehicle
2.2.34-101.info: As with other accidents, in the event of a wildlife accident it is also necessary to stop, switch on the hazard warning lights and secure the scene of the accident.The police must be notified. As a rule, the police officers will then also notify the responsible hunters or foresters.
2.2.34-101.text: Your vehicle has collided with a wild animal. What is the right course of action here?

2.7.01-150.asw_1: - The front of the car can swerve
2.7.01-150.asw_3: - The rear of the car can swerve
2.7.01-150.info: Passenger cars with front drive tend to understeer, i.e., the front tends to turn out to the side if the motorist accelerates too much in a curve.
2.7.01-150.text: What can result if you accelerate too hard when driving a front-wheel drive car through a road bend?

2.7.01-151.asw_1: - has detected an adequately marked carriageway with multiple lanes
2.7.01-151.asw_2: - has not detected any vehicles in the relevant safety zone
2.7.01-151.asw_3: - has detected a sufficiently large gap in the oncoming traffic
2.7.01-151.info: A lane change assistant can only work reliably if the lane markings are clearly visible.If the assistant detects a vehicle in the relevant safety zone, it will not change lanes.The lane change assistant does not detect gaps in oncoming traffic.
2.7.01-151.text: Under what conditions can an active lane change assist system perform a lane change?

2.7.02-135.asw_1: If there is a permanent noise when braking
2.7.02-135.asw_2: If the airbag indicator light does not switch off after the engine is started
2.7.02-135.asw_3: If you have to continuously counter-steer when driving in a straight line
2.7.02-135.info: Since steering, brakes and airbags are important for safety, all three answers are correct.
2.7.02-135.text: When should you arrange for your car to be inspected in a garage?

2.7.06-115.info: The adaptive cruise control system allows the driver to select a constant driving speed between approx. 30 km/h and approx. 200 km/h (depending on the vehicle). The radar-based system pays attention to the traffic ahead and, if the safety distance is too small, the system automatically regulates the distance either by reducing the speed or by braking.The use of an AGR is therefore suitable on highways and freeways. On winding roads, the distance to the traffic ahead is more difficult to detect, so AGR is not so suitable here.
2.7.06-115.text: In which situation is it helpful to use an adaptive cruise control system (ACC)?

1.2.12-131.info:
StVO § 12 Stopping and parking

(3) Parking is not permitted1. in front of and behind intersections and junctions up to 5 m from the intersection of the roadway edges,

if a bicycle lane is built on the right side of the roadway in the direction of travel, in front of intersections and junctions up to 8 m from the intersection of the roadway edges,

2.2.04-004.info: Outside of town, the safety distance should be at least half the speed. Half of 100 is 50, which means a distance of at least 50 m should be kept.

1.1.06-131-M.asw_2: I move to the right, onto the parking strip

1.1.07-168-M.asw_3: I accelerate because I have priority
1.1.07-168-M.info: The blue vehicle parks out, apparently having overlooked me. To avoid an accident, I brake.As there is a motorcycle on the oncoming lane, I cannot swerve to the left."I accelerate because I have priority " would mean to accept an accident consciously only to be right. So wrong answer.

1.2.09-136-M.info: The pedestrian has "green", he will not wait.The bus will not leave immediately, some passengers are still boarding.The oncoming vehicle is just overtaking the bus and possibly the traffic light has been obscured by the bus. I must expect that the driver will not stop and go straight ahead.
1.2.09-136-M.text: What must you anticipate in this situation?

1.2.09-137-M.info: I just passed an electric scooter in the bike lane that is probably going straight. At the moment it is in the "blind spot".I have to stop because the electric scooter has priority.I don't have to stop because of the streetcar or because of pedestrians.

1.2.11-006.info: If traffic is at a standstill, vehicles may not occupy the pedestrian crossing if they have to wait. If there is traffic congestion, you must not occupy the intersection or junction despite the right of way or green light signal if you have to wait.

1.2.12-132.asw_1: In front of fire service access roads
1.2.12-132.info: StVO § 12 Stopping and parking(1) Stopping is not permitted5. in front of and in officially marked fire department access roads.Stopping may be permitted in one-way streets and no-parking zones.

1.2.34-007.asw_1: - deliver first aid to the injured
1.2.34-007.info: The first step is to secure the scene of the accident, then to provide first aid and then to alert the rescue service.
1.2.34-007.text: You are the first to arrive at the scene of the accident where there are injured people. You secure the scene of the accident and have gained an overview of the situation. What else do you have to do?

1.2.34-008.asw_1: Photographing the scene of the accident from a number of angles
1.2.34-008.asw_2: Exchanging the necessary details with those involved
1.2.34-008.asw_3: Describing the cause of the accident in the accident report
1.2.34-008.info: In the case of minor accidents without any doubt as to who is at fault, it is not necessary to call the police.You should always get the phone number, identity card number and insurance details. Photos of the accident situation and a description of how the accident occurred and the damage caused can also be helpful later when presenting the situation for settlement of the claim by the insurance company.

1.4.41-022.asw_3: Cyclists have to use the footpaths to the left and right of the roadway

1.4.41-025.asw_2: - may stop to quickly load my vehicle
1.4.41-025.asw_3: - may stop to allow passengers to exit my vehicle

2.1.02-005-M.asw_1: Children walking out onto the road
2.1.02-005-M.asw_2: People exiting their vehicles via the side nearest the road
2.1.02-005-M.asw_3: There is a pedestrian crossing up ahead
2.1.02-005-M.info: The parked vehicles restrict the view of the sidewalk. Children and other pedestrians could run out between the vehicles at any time. Motorists are driving next to parked vehicles. A door could open at any time, threatening danger and making it necessary to drive slowly.

2.1.03-121.asw_1: I reduce my speed, because it is too high
2.1.03-121.asw_2: I maintain my speed, because the ESC system ensures I can continue driving safely
2.1.03-121.asw_3: I go to a garage, because the ESC display is indicating a fault

2.1.06-028-M.asw_1: - do not have an adequate view of the road ahead

2.1.06-028-M.asw_3: - may not cross over the central lane markings
2.1.06-028-M.info:
StVO § 5 Overtaking

(2) Overtaking is only permitted to anyone who can see that there is no obstruction to oncoming traffic during the entire overtaking process.

Furthermore, overtaking is only permitted to anyone who is driving at a significantly higher speed than the person being overtaken.

Since the overtaking lane is not visible due to the upcoming right-hand bend, overtaking is not permitted here.When overtaking cyclists, the prescribed lateral distance outside built-up areas is at least 2 m. If oncoming traffic cannot keep a sufficient lateral distance to the cyclists, overtaking is not permitted here.The guide line is not continuous, it may be crossed.
2.1.06-028-M.text: Why are you not allowed to overtake here?

2.1.06-104-M.asw_1: I do not overtake the cyclists for now
2.1.06-104-M.asw_3: I sound my horn to prompt the cyclists to ride one behind the other
2.1.06-104-M.info: When overtaking cyclists, the prescribed lateral distance in built-up areas is at least 1.5 m. Since it is not possible to maintain a sufficient lateral distance to cyclists when overtaking, overtaking is not permitted here.Honking is also not allowed.StVO § 16 Warning signs(1) Sound and light signals may only be given by,1. anyone overtaking outside built-up areas (§ 5 (5)) or2. who sees himself or others in danger.
2.1.06-104-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

2.1.06-105.asw_1: I slow down to walking speed

Therefore, slow down to walking speed and drive as far to the right as possible.

2.1.08-031.asw_3: - achieves an even flow of traffic
2.1.08-031.info: The guideline speed is intended to avoid dangerous and traffic jam situations. High speed and especially high speed differences between the different lanes leads to increased congestion and more (serious) accidents.

2.1.11-018.asw_1: Because this can increase the risk of driving errors
2.1.11-018.asw_2: Because the time gained by this is generally very small
2.1.11-018.asw_3: Because this can endanger other road users
2.1.11-018.info: Of course, all three answers are correct.

2.2.07-013-M.asw_2: – may only be used by trucks

2.2.07-013-M.info:
The gantry shows a diagonal red cross above the side strip, thus the use of the side strip is prohibited.

Likewise, the sign 223.2 (blue sign to the left and right of the gantry) indicates "Do not use the side strip".The hard shoulder may therefore only be used in the event of a breakdown.

2.4.41-108.info: Sign 277.1"Anyone driving a multi-lane motor vehicle may not overtake single or multi-lane vehicles."So there is a ban on overtaking, where even single-lane vehicles are not allowed to overtake.

2.4.41-109.info: The overtaking ban applies to buses and passenger cars with trailers.The overtaking ban does not apply to single-track motor vehicles and cars without trailers.
2.4.41-109.text: What motor vehicles are subject to the no-overtaking rule indicated by this sign?

2.5.01-018.asw_3: - that with alternative fuels it is only possible to drive slowly
2.5.01-018.info: Above all, environmentally friendly driving means driving with foresight. Hazards are usually detected at an earlier stage. At the same time, high speeds are avoided, which means that dangerous situations occur less frequently.
2.5.01-018.text: Why is an environmentally considerate driving style also beneficial for road safety?

2.5.01-127.asw_1: Using a high energy recovery (recuperation) level
2.5.01-127.info: An electric motor has hardly any waste heat, so the heating power is drawn directly from the battery. The power consumption for this is by no means negligible and has a corresponding negative impact on the range.When braking, recuperation turns the electric motor into a generator. Part of the kinetic energy is converted back into electricity, thus charging the battery.Short, strong acceleration requires a lot of energy and thus shortens the range.
2.5.01-127.text: What increases the range of an electric vehicle?

2.6.02-038.asw_2: At the time of the next inspection
2.6.02-038.asw_3: When demanded by the registration authority
2.6.02-038.info: Changes to the vehicle that require acceptance by the vehicle licensing authority require an immediate assessment; there is no transitional period.

2.6.03-115.asw_1: - reduce my speed to avoid skidding
2.6.03-115.asw_2: - accelerate to keep the combination vehicle in a straight line
2.6.03-115.info: The lower the speed, the lower the risk of skidding with the trailer.
2.6.03-115.text: You are driving with a trailer on a road with potholes. Your combination vehicle begins to swing up. What must you do now?

2.7.01-152.info: The status display of the system shows whether it is switched on, switched off or has a fault.All three answers are correct.
2.7.01-152.text: Your motor vehicle is equipped with an active lane keep assist system. What information can be indicated by the status display of this system?

2.7.01-153.asw_1: - I depart from my lane unintentionally
2.7.01-153.asw_2: - the maximum permissible speed is exceeded
2.7.01-153.asw_3: - the vehicle is driving too quickly over ruts in the road
2.7.01-153.asw_pretext: The system will warn me when
2.7.01-153.info: The speed is not controlled by the lane departure warning system, nor does it detect the maximum permissible speed. The system also does not detect lane grooves.The system warns when unintentionally leaving the lane.
2.7.01-153.text: Your motor vehicle is equipped with a lane keep assist system. In what situation can this system help you?

2.7.01-154.asw_1: I forgot to switch on my indicator when changing lane
2.7.01-154.asw_2: I have unintentionally departed from my lane
2.7.01-154.asw_3: I undercut the minimum distance between me and the vehicle ahead
2.7.01-154.info: Lane Keeping Assist warns the driver if the vehicle unintentionally leaves its lane. If the turn signal is not activated, the system assumes that the lane change is unintentional.The minimum distance to the vehicle in front is not detected by Lane Keeping Assist; other assistants or the driver are responsible for this.
2.7.01-154.text: You have the lane keep assist system activated in your motor vehicle. It emits a warning signal while you are driving. What could be the cause of this?

2.7.01-155.info:
The lane departure warning system can be impaired in its function in many situations, e.g. by:<

  • Snowfall
  • insufficient road illumination
  • heavy rain
  • missing lane markings
  • fog
  • direct sunlight
  • tight curves
2.7.01-155.text: You are using your motor vehicle’s lane keep assist system while driving. The system does not respond when you depart from the lane. What could be the cause of this?

2.7.01-156.asw_1: Another vehicle is located within the monitored area
2.7.01-156.asw_2: You may not now perform a lane change to the left
2.7.01-156.asw_3: You can now perform a lane change to the left without any risk
2.7.01-156.info: The sensors of the lane change assistant detect the area next to the vehicle up to approx. 4 meters and to the rear they detect an area up to approx. 50 meters.The warning light indicates another vehicle in this area, so no lane change to the left may be made at this time.
2.7.01-156.text: Your motor vehicle is equipped with a lane change assist system without steering intervention. While driving, the warning light flashes on the left-hand exterior rear-view mirror. What is this warning light indicating?

2.7.01-157.info: Active Lane Keeping Assist can be overridden by activating the turn signal and by countersteering.The speed is not controlled by Lane Keeping Assist, so the system cannot be overridden by accelerating.
2.7.01-157.text: While driving, you are using your motor vehicle’s active lane keep assist system. How can you manually override this driver assist system in the event that it intervenes?

2.7.01-158.info: Lane Change Assist requires relatively easily recognizable lane markings for orientation; this is usually the case on freeways and highway-like roads.The system can be impaired in many situations, e.g. by snowfall, rain, fog, direct sunlight, tight curves.Clearly, the lane change assistant cannot function on roads without markings.
2.7.01-158.text: In which situation is it purposeful to use an active lane change assist system?

2.7.01-159.asw_1: The systems independently performs the lane change
2.7.01-159.asw_2: I have to monitor the lane change
2.7.01-159.asw_3: The system always maintains all safety distances independently
2.7.01-159.info: Active Lane Change Assist can change lanes independently.The sensors of the lane change assistant detect the area next to the vehicle up to 3 - 4 meters and to the rear they detect an area up to 50 meters. The area in front of the vehicle is not detected; other assistants or the driver are responsible for this.However, the lane change carried out by the lane change assistant must be monitored by the driver.
2.7.01-159.text: You want to overtake and you have initiated a lane change using the active lane change assist system. What is correct?

2.7.02-136.info: Poorly balanced or damaged front wheels are a possible reason for a wobbling steering wheel.Defective shock absorbers, a defective suspension or a faulty wheel mounting are also possible causes.
2.7.02-136.text: When accelerating, you notice that the steering wheel trembles. How should you do here?

2.7.02-137.asw_1: I have to arrange for the seatbelt to be replaced
2.7.02-137.asw_2: I may not use the seat any longer
2.7.02-137.asw_3: I have to adjust the seatbelt height adjuster
2.7.02-137.info: The facts are clear:§21a seat belts, ...(1) Prescribed seat belts must be worn while driving; ...Therefore, the seat may no longer be used and the seat belt must be replaced.Adjusting the seat belt height adjustment would not remedy the defect.
2.7.02-137.text: The front passenger seatbelt is defective. What must you do?

2.7.06-116.info:
A cruise control system ensures that the preset speed is maintained constantly while driving.

Depressing the accelerator or brake pedal overrides the cruise control. Steering has no influence on the cruise control.
2.7.06-116.text: How can you manually override an activated cruise control system?

2.7.06-117.asw_1: - independently accelerates the vehicle until it reaches a previously set speed
2.7.06-117.asw_2: - independently slows the vehicle if it identifies a vehicle ahead travelling at a lower speed
2.7.06-117.asw_3: - always maintains the prescribed safety distance to the vehicle ahead
2.7.06-117.info:
The speed is automatically regulated, i.e., the vehicle accelerates until the set speed is reached. When approaching a vehicle in front at a lower speed, the system adjusts its own speed accordingly.

The safety distance required in each case depends on various factors and cannot be detected or known by the system.
2.7.06-117.text: What is the purpose of an adaptive cruise control system (ACC) in motor vehicles?

1.2.12-133.info: StVO § 12. 3"Parking is not permitted in front of and behind intersections and junctions up to 5 m from the intersection of the roadway edges, if a bicycle lane is built on the right side of the roadway in the direction of travel, in front of intersections and junctions up to 8 m from the intersection of the roadway edges".
1.2.12-133.text: You are looking for a place to park on the right edge of the carriageway. A cycle path runs alongside to the right of the carriageway. How many metres before a junction or an intersection are you prohibited from parking?

2.2.03-025.info:
The speed shall be adapted in particular to road, traffic, visibility and weather conditions as well as to the specific abilities and characteristics of the vehicle and load.

If visibility due to fog, snow or rain is less than 50 m, the speed must not exceed 50 km/h unless a lower speed is required.
2.2.03-025.text: You are driving in foggy conditions on the motorway. Your visibility range is less than 50 m. How fast are you allowed to drive?

2.2.04-107.asw_pretext: Answer: From a length of more than
2.2.04-107.info: Anyone driving a vehicle combination longer than 7 m must, outside of built-up areas, constantly maintain sufficient distance from the motor vehicle in front to allow an overtaking motor vehicle to pull in.
2.2.04-107.text: When driving outside of a built-up area, from what combination vehicle length must you maintain a large enough distance to the vehicle ahead as to allow an overtaking vehicle to pull back into lane in front of you?

2.2.22-129.info: The load may protrude to the rear up to 1.50 m, but up to 3 m when transported over a distance of up to 100 km.
2.2.22-129.text: How far may a labelled load protrude beyond the rear of your vehicle if your journey is more than 100 km?

2.6.03-116.info: A motor vehicle of category B may carry no more than one trailer.
2.6.03-116.text: What number of trailers may be towed behind a car?

1.1.02-051-M.asw_1: I stop and allow the person to cross the road
1.1.02-051-M.asw_2: I drive to the left past the person, leaving sufficient clearance space
1.1.02-051-M.asw_3: I flash my headlights to signal to the person that I am giving way
1.1.02-051-M.info: The armband and the dog indicate that the pedestrian is visually impaired. It is your duty to stop and let the pedestrian cross the road.
1.1.02-051-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.1.02-136-M.asw_2: Because the bus is moving off
1.1.02-136-M.info:
Scheduled buses, trams and marked school buses stopping at bus stops may only be overtaken carefully, even if they are oncoming traffic.

A passenger who has left the bus appears to want to cross the roadway in front of the bus.
1.1.02-136-M.text: Why must you drive slowly now, and be ready to brake?

1.1.02-137-M.info: The speed must be reduced because a child behind the vehicle parked on the right threatens to run onto the road.
1.1.02-137-M.text: Why are you required to brake here?

1.1.06-005-M.asw_1: Because the cyclist could turn off to the left
1.1.06-005-M.asw_2: Because I am not able to see possible oncoming traffic in good enough time
1.1.06-005-M.asw_3: Because of the very poor condition of the left-side road surface
1.1.06-005-M.info: Although the cyclist does not give a hand signal, she could turn left to follow the other cyclist.Possible oncoming traffic cannot be detected in time by the parked cars, so I am not allowed to overtake here.
1.1.06-005-M.text: Why are you not allowed to overtake now?

1.1.07-025-M.asw_3: I manoeuvre over to the left side of the road
1.1.07-025-M.info: The behavior of the cyclist is not foreseeable. There is a risk that he will drive off, which would result in a collision.The oncoming vehicle prohibits a swerve to the left half of the lane.
1.1.07-025-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.1.07-169-M.asw_1: The driver of the yellow vehicle opens the driver-side door
1.1.07-169-M.asw_2: The blue truck pulls out to the left
1.1.07-169-M.asw_3: The cyclist pulls out to the left
1.1.07-169-M.info: All three answers are correct.The cyclist is very likely to swerve to the left and not stop behind the vehicle.The truck has just started and may be swerving to the left to make a turn.The vehicle has just stopped and the driver may be able to open the door.

1.1.07-170.asw_1: I continue to follow the traffic reports
1.1.07-170.asw_2: I take particular care when driving around bends and on the approach to summits
1.1.07-170.asw_3: I apply the emergency brake assist to safely stop before the tail end of the traffic jam
1.1.07-170.info: In the event of a possible traffic jam, it is important to drive with particular attention. Especially in curves and before crests, the end of the traffic jam must be expected at any time.It is also advisable to continue to follow the traffic reports.The emergency brake assistant cannot be used in a planned manner to stop safely. It intervenes automatically in a dangerous situation.
1.1.07-170.text: You are driving on a section of road where a traffic jam has been reported. What is the right course of action?

1.1.07-171.info: The cyclist coming from the left has the right of way. That's why I have to stop.
1.1.07-171.text: Why are you required to stop now?

1.1.07-172-M.asw_1: I perform an emergency braking manoeuvre
1.1.07-172-M.asw_2: I continue driving, ready to brake
1.1.07-172-M.info: There is a risk of collision with the cyclist coming from the left. He seems to be driving on despite the red traffic light, so that a collision can only be avoided by means of an emergency braking manoeuvre.
1.1.07-172-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.1.10-001.asw_3: I try to perform my trips around noon
1.1.10-001.info: Regular breaks and drink enough fluids is useful in high temperatures.At high noon, in the greatest heat to drive certainly not.
1.1.10-001.text: When ambient temperatures are high, this negatively affects driver concentration during long journeys and accident numbers rise. Which of the following is it advisable to do, so that you remain alert and can drive safely, even during high summer?

1.2.05-126-M.asw_2: I overtake the cyclist with a sufficient amount of side clearance
1.2.05-126-M.asw_3: I have to allow the pedestrian to cross the road
1.2.05-126-M.info: When overtaking in the inner city, you must maintain a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters from cyclists.Since the continuous line may also not be partially crossed, overtaking the cyclist is not allowed.
1.2.05-126-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.07-105-M.asw_1: I move over to the right-hand lane after around 200 m
1.2.07-105-M.asw_2: I may overtake the vehicles driving in the right-hand lane
1.2.07-105-M.asw_3: I move into the right-hand lane now
1.2.07-105-M.info:
The left lane ends, two lanes merge. It is necessary to drive up to the narrowing of the lane and then merge into the right lane.

StVO § 7 Para. 4 states that the change to the continuous lane should only take place immediately before the narrowing. I may therefore overtake the vehicles in the right lane and do not yet change to the right lane.
1.2.07-105-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.09-138-M.asw_1: I allow the cyclist to pass through
1.2.09-138-M.asw_2: I glance over my right shoulder
1.2.09-138-M.asw_3: I take the turn ahead of the electric scooter
1.2.09-138-M.info: The StVO § 9 para. 3 clearly states here:"Anyone who wants to turn must let oncoming vehicles pass, rail vehicles, bicycles with auxiliary motors, bicycles and miniature electric vehicles even if they are traveling on or next to the roadway in the same direction."Therefore, I am not allowed to turn in front of the electric scooter and must let the cyclist pass.The shoulder view must be carried out, as I must make sure that no other road users are endangered.
1.2.09-138-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.2.20-108-M.asw_2: I drive with an increased level of alertness
1.2.20-108-M.asw_3: I slow down to walking speed now
1.2.20-108-M.info: Buses on regular routes, streetcars and marked school buses that stop at bus stops may only be passed with caution, even in oncoming traffic.My speed of 30 km/h is appropriate and does not need to be reduced.The bus does not have its hazard lights on, so I do not have to drive at walking speed.
1.2.20-108-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?<pcaption>(Hazard lights are off)</pcaption>

1.2.26-010-M.asw_2: I reduce my speed and prepare to stop if necessary
1.2.26-010-M.asw_3: I continue driving at the same speed
1.2.26-010-M.info: The pedestrians appear to want to cross the street at the crosswalk and therefore have priority. By reducing my speed, I signal that the pedestrians can move onto the street.
1.2.26-010-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.34-009.asw_1: - leave my name and address at the scene of the accident
1.2.34-009.asw_2: - report the accident to the police
1.2.34-009.asw_3: - give my name and address to a witness not involved in the accident
1.2.34-009.info: It is necessary to wait a reasonable amount of time according to the circumstances and to leave one's name and address at the scene of the accident. In addition, the findings shall  abe made possible retrospectively without delay if one is entitled, excused or removed from the scene of the accident after the waiting period has expired. To this end, at least the entitled individuals or a nearby police station must be informed that they have been involved in the accident and given their address and the location of their vehicle. Additionally, the registration number and the location of the vehicle involved must be stated and the vehicle must be made available for immediate findings for a reasonable period of time.
1.2.34-009.text: Your vehicle has damaged someone else’s parked vehicle. Despite waiting a reasonable period of time, the owner of the damaged car fails to appear. What is the right course of action now?

1.2.36-015-M.info: When a police officer is directing traffic at an intersection, his instructions take precedence over all other rules, such as traffic lights and right-of-way signs.If the police officer holds both arms out to the side across the direction of travel, it means STOP. I must wait before the intersection.The motorcycle must wait because it wants to turn.The car coming from the left drives first.

1.3.01-040-M.asw_1: The green car may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-040-M.asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-040-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the green car
1.3.01-040-M.info: The car coming from the left follows the course of the priority road and therefore has priority, it drives first.Both vehicles on the priority road have priority over me, so I drive last.
1.3.01-040-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

1.3.01-041-M.asw_1: I may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-041-M.asw_2: The yellow car may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-041-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-041-M.info: The vehicle coming from the right follows the course of the priority road and drives first.Since I am on the priority road, I drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
1.3.01-041-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

1.3.01-043-M.asw_1: The motorbike may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-043-M.asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-043-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the motorbike
1.3.01-043-M.info: The oncoming vehicle follows the course of the turning priority road and drives first.According to the basic rule right before left, I may drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
1.3.01-043-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

2.1.03-037.asw_2: For the poor visibility of my vehicle
2.1.03-037.info: Wetness impairs visibility and thus impairs road safety. The splash water of the preceding vehicles indicates a very wet roadway. This can significantly reduce traction.
2.1.03-037.text: What should you be prepared for here?

2.1.03-038.asw_1: When driving into the truck’s wind-sheltered area
2.1.03-038.asw_2: When driving out of the truck’s wind-sheltered area
2.1.03-038.info: When driving into the slipstream of the truck, the crosswind is compensated so that the car pulls to the right. When you leave the slipstream, the crosswind returns, making counter-steering necessary.
2.1.03-038.text: Where are you particularly at risk during an overtaking manoeuvre here?

2.1.03-122.asw_2: A reduced amount of side clearance from oncoming traffic
2.1.03-122.asw_3: That you may be dazzled by the low-lying sun
2.1.03-122.info: There are vehicles in a car park for hikers. Therefore, one should anticipate pedestrians who may also walk on the road due to the snow. Snow and slush at the side of the road additionally narrow the roadway.

2.1.03-123.asw_1: I gently take my foot off the accelerator
2.1.03-123.asw_2: I keep the steering wheel as straight as possible
2.1.03-123.info: In the case of aquaplaning, the tire has lost contact with the road surface. Therefore, I must not steer, brake, accelerate or make any hectic driving maneuvers at this time.Carefully taking your foot off the gas pedal and keeping the steering wheel as straight as possible is the correct behavior.
2.1.03-123.text: While driving straight ahead, you lose control of your vehicle due to aquaplaning. What is the proper response now?

2.1.06-029-M.asw_1: Because the side clearance to the cyclists is too small
2.1.06-029-M.asw_2: Because I may endanger oncoming traffic
2.1.06-029-M.asw_3: Because I may not cross the centre line
2.1.06-029-M.info: A blue truck is in the oncoming lane. As a result, overtaking would endanger oncoming traffic and the necessary lateral distance of 1.5 m to the cyclists would not be possible.Thus, overtaking is out of the question.
2.1.06-029-M.text: Why are you not allowed to overtake here?

2.1.06-030.asw_1: Side clearances are frequently misjudged in this situation
2.1.06-030.asw_2: Vehicles with high superstructures frequently perform evasive manoeuvres to avoid branches in this situation
2.1.06-030.asw_3: Accidents involving trees are particularly frequent here
2.1.06-030.info: Due to the trees located close to the roadway, certain vehicles may be forced to use the center of the roadway. Thus, there is an increased risk of collision and, at the same time, overtaking is made more difficult.Due to the constant change of light and shade, side distances as well as oncoming traffic are often difficult to judge.Due to the many trees, tree accidents also occur more frequently in avenues.
2.1.06-030.text: You want to overtake on a tree-lined avenue. What special aspect should you bear in mind?

2.1.06-106-M.info: When overtaking in inner-city traffic, you must maintain a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters from the cyclist.Since this is not possible due to the traffic island, I reduce my speed and do not overtake the cyclist.
2.1.06-106-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

2.2.04-105-M.asw_1: - is appropriate because the overtaking vehicle can pull back into lane in front of me
2.2.04-105-M.asw_2: - to the overtaking vehicle must be re-established once it has pulled back into lane
2.2.04-105-M.asw_3: - is too large because it exceeds the length of my combination vehicle many times over
2.2.04-105-M.info: Trains are often traveling slowly by comparison. To enable other road users to overtake safely, a distance must be maintained that allows overtaking vehicles to merge safely.In this case, the distance to the vehicle in front is appropriate and must be restored against after the overtaking maneuver.
2.2.04-105-M.text: You are driving a car with a caravan in tow. What is true regarding your distance to the vehicle ahead?

2.2.04-106.asw_1: - the braking distance may be extended
2.2.04-106.asw_2: - the handling of the car may vary
2.2.04-106.asw_3: - my reaction time may become longer
2.2.04-106.info: The higher the weight of a vehicle, the longer the braking distance. Driving behavior, e.g. in curves, also changes with increasing weight.
2.2.04-106.text: You are driving a heavily loaded car. Why should you maintain a greater safety distance to the vehicle ahead?

2.2.05-019.asw_1: Because the hazard lights of the bus are switched on
2.2.05-019.asw_3: Because of the lack of road markings
2.2.05-019.info: Buses and marked school buses that are approaching a stop and have their hazard warning lights on may not be overtaken.The overtaking motorcycle is on my left, therefore I am also not allowed to overtake.The lack of lane markings is not a reason for prohibiting overtaking.
2.2.05-019.text: Why are you not permitted to now overtake the bus driving ahead of you?

2.2.06-101-M.asw_2: I queue behind the vehicles already waiting on the right
2.2.06-101-M.asw_3: I continue driving at a reduced speed
2.2.06-101-M.info: If you want to drive past a narrowing of the roadway, an obstacle on the roadway or a stopping vehicle on the left, you must allow oncoming vehicles to pass. There is not enough room to allow you to safely pass the cyclist, so you have to wait.
2.2.06-101-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

2.2.14-108-M.asw_1: - by looking in my left-hand exterior rear-view mirror before opening the door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_2: - by glancing over my left shoulder before opening the door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_3: - just by looking through the slightly opened door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_pretext: I observe the traffic approaching from the rear
2.2.14-108-M.info: Anyone getting on or off the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no risk to other road users.This requires looking over the shoulder and observing the traffic in the left-hand side mirror.
2.2.14-108-M.text: You have stopped in a parking strip and now want to exit your vehicle. What must you do in this situation?

2.2.14-109.info: Motor vehicles must be secured against unauthorized use. Therefore, windows must be closed and doors locked.
2.2.14-109.text: When leaving your car, how do you secure it against unauthorised use?

2.2.17-013.info: The blue indicator lamp indicates that the main beam is switched on.
2.2.17-013.text: How can you tell that your main beam lights are switched on?

2.2.34-102.asw_1: - makes it easier to document the accident with foreign-speaking parties involved in the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_2: - enables the parties involved to independently document the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_3: - unambiguously clarifies the issue of liability at the scene of the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_pretext: Because, in the event of an accident, the European accident report form
2.2.34-102.info: The European accident report is a standardized form used throughout Europe to document the course of an accident.It facilitates and enables the recording of the accident, especially when different languages are spoken.Each party involved in the accident fills out an accident report and each party receives a copy of the completed report.The information provided is not an admission of guilt, and the question of liability is not clarified by the accident report.
2.2.34-102.text: Why should you always carry the European accident report form with you on your journey?

2.2.38-101.asw_1: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
2.2.38-101.info: Blue flashing light together with the emergency horn orders: "All other road users must clear the way immediately".Since there is no oncoming traffic in sight, drive as far to the right as possible and reduce speed sufficiently in this situation.Stopping is not necessary.
2.2.38-101.text: A vehicle with flashing blue lights and siren sounding is approaching you from the rear. What is the right course of action now?

2.5.01-128.asw_3: - means that energy can be recovered from the braking operation
2.5.01-128.info: Recuperation refers to a technical process for recovering energy.In electric vehicles, the electric motor becomes a generator as soon as the foot is taken off the gas pedal while driving.  Electrical energy is recovered and fed back into the battery.Depending on the recuperation strength set, braking is stepped up and more electricity is generated.The service brake system is spared because it is used less often.
2.5.01-128.text: What is the benefit of recuperation in an electric vehicle?

2.7.01-160.info: Active Parking Assist and Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) can be activated and deactivated manually.Emergency Brake Assist cannot be activated or deactivated manually.
2.7.01-160.text: Which driver assistance systems do you have to manually activate to assist you in specific situations?

2.7.05-005.asw_1: There will be a considerable deterioration in the vehicle’s manoeuvrability
2.7.05-005.asw_2: The vehicle’s stability will be dangerously reduced when cornering
2.7.05-005.asw_3: The level of tyre wear will decrease greatly
2.7.05-005.info: If the tire pressure is significantly too low, the tire loses its stability. This worsens driving stability and steering behavior.Tire wear increases sharply and does not decrease.
2.7.05-005.text: Your tyre inflation pressure is clearly too low while you driving on public roads. What is the consequence of this?
